title: Annuity Associate
description:
**Title:** Annuity Associate ‘B’ Grade 5 (OPEIU L153)

**Rate of Pay:** $57,097.93 (Weekly: $1,014.04 + $84.00 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Department**: Annuity

**Location:** 158-11 Harry Van Arsdale Jr Ave, Fresh Meadows, NY 11365

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

The annuity department is seeking an experienced Annuity Associate ‘B’ with excellent customer service skills. Under close supervision, reporting to Supervisor and Assistant Supervisor of Annuity, the Annuity Associate ‘B’ will be responsible for various duties, including but not limited to the following:

* Serve as the primary Customer Service Representative and screen all incoming calls.
* Processing all types of claims for the Annuity Fund, Additional Security Benefits Fund, Health Reimbursement Plan, Vacation, Holiday Unemployment Plan, and the Employer Portion of the Deferred Salary Plan.
* Reviewing and process the following documents accordingly, but not limited to:
* o Divorce papers, including Stipulations, Facts and Conclusions.
* o Power of Attorney papers.
* o Guardianship forms.
* o Adoption decree, certificate, Amended Birth Certificate, etc.
* o Documentation on name changes.
* Checks claims for account balance, proper documentation, and general eligibility. All claims are keyed in by the processor online.
* Accepting the daily check runs from IT, checking for errors and having checks signed to prepare. for mailing.
* Sorting and distributing mail for all areas of the Annuity Department.
* Handles all customer service calls (high volume) in addition to assisting members in reception area.
* May perform other related clerical duties.

**Work Environment** 

We thrive to provide a supportive and collaborative environment. We are employee- focused emphasizing mutual respect a strong sense of community and a positive team culture. We offer a healthy work -life balances and a desirable work environment with a diverse workforce.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday 8:30AM-4:30PM.

**Flexibility**: Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel**: No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* Previous Paralegal or Legal Assistance experience preferred.
* Certified Notary Public Preferred.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* Must have the ability to handle complex problems and multi-task.
* Demonstrable computer skills (Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, Adobe).
* This is a high-volume position which requires attention to detail, speed, and accuracy.
* Must be comfortable working with numbers.
* Must adhere to a confidential code of ethics.
* Ability to work professionally and cooperatively with others.
* Must have experience working with legal documents.

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**BENEFITS**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K (before FICA gross-up reimbursement) *without* mandatory matching, vested immediately before.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation.
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date: Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, NO employee premium. Coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, and DDS/Empire Dental. In addition, eligible employees may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability.
* NYS Paid Family Leave.

* 11 Paid Holidays

title: Soccer Coach
description:
We currently have a coaching position available: Assistant Coach for our all-girls Varsity Soccer Team. We are part of the Catholic High School Athletic Association. We have a lot of girls interested in the sport and with lots of potential. So, not only is it important for us to look for someone who knows the sport well enough to coach it, but also someone responsible, dedicated, and committed. We are also looking for someone who:

* enjoys working with accomplished athletes and those with little or no soccer experience.
* is committed to nurturing athletes in a supportive environment that supports goal setting, perseverance, and a love for the sport.

**Responsibilities**

* Assist in coaching and instructing athletes, both individually and in groups, using appropriate soccer developmental instruction.
* Assist in using various instructional techniques and media to meet the needs and improve student-athletes abilities in the sport assigned.
* Assist the Directors of Athletics and other coaches with organizing and supervising athletes in connection with practices and games and any other school function and/or activities involving their sports team.
* Assist in managing and supervising athletic activities, contests, and practice sessions to promote individual growth in athletic skills, teamwork, and good sportsmanship.
* Assist in leading and/or assisting practices.
* Accompany, attend, and supervise student-athletes during athletic competitions.
* Attend meetings that are related to their sport.
* Assist in applying for field permits for practices, league games, non-league games, and scrimmages.
* Take all necessary precautions to protect student-athletes, equipment, materials, and facilities.
* Develop and sustain positive relationships with athletes, families, and guests of St. Vincent Ferrer High School.
* Supporting the safety of all members, guests and employees.
* Encourage, by example and through instruction, sportsmanlike conduct in all phases of athletic participation.

**Qualifications**

* Two or more years of coaching experience with demonstrated leadership ability for coaches and at least one year of experience for assistant coaches.
* Collegiate playing experience is a plus.
* General knowledge of coaching techniques and procedures.
* Ability to instruct students and manage their behavior.
* Knowledge of Girls' Soccer rules.
* Strong work ethic and organizational skills.
* Great communication skills.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Strong problem-solving skills.
* Background check required.
* Knowledgeable of safety training, procedures, and best practices used throughout the sports and wellness industry.

**Additional Information**:

* The Soccer Season begins around the second to last week of August and ends roughly around the end of October or the beginning of November. During the off-season (March-July), coaches are welcome to host clinics, for which they will be compensated.

**School Location**:

St. Vincent Ferrer High School is an all-girls school and is located on East 65th Street/Lexington Avenue.

We are near several train stations:

* 59th Street & Lexington Avenue (Train Lines: 4,5,6,R,N,W)
* 63rd Street & Lexington Avenue (Train Lines: F, Q)
* 68th Street & Lexington Avenue (Train Line: 6)

For more information about our school, please visit the school website.

title: Phlebotomist / Floater
description:
This is an exciting time to join our dynamic organization! BioReference, an OPKO Health company, is the largest full service specialty laboratory in the United States that gives healthcare providers and patients the power to make confident healthcare decisions. With a focus on oncology, urology and women’s health, BioReference offers comprehensive test solutions and unparalleled expertise based on a 40 year legacy of proven science and exceptional service. Join our team and become part of the journey in making our patients and customers the highest priority

**Job Description**

We are looking for a Floater Phlebotomist (40 hours per week) in our Elmwood Park NJ location. Schedule: Monday - Friday 7a-9p Saturday 8a-3p

**POSITION SUMMARY:**

The Phlebotomist aims to serve patients by preparing specimens for laboratories testing and performing screening standards. The Phlebotomist shall draw quality blood samples while creating an atmosphere of trust and confidence.

**PRINCIPAL JOB DUTIES:**  
Duties may include but are not necessarily limited to the following:

* Experience doing blood draws, labeling specimens, centrifuging specimens, recording maintenance data and decontamination, updating patient information, etc.
* Greet customers appropriately; treat all customers in a courteous manner
* Collects specimens according to established procedures. Properly explains in a clear but courteous manner the process of the venipuncture (blood drawing) and or other specimen collection (ex. urine or fecal) as required
* Reduces patient anxiety by providing a calm environment for patients before, during and after the collection process
* Demonstrate technique/s using straight needles and/or butterfly needles.
* Fully understand all of the physicians' orders
* Matches laboratory requisition forms to specimen tubes; label, centrifuge, split, and freeze specimens as required by test order
* Check all test requisitions or computer label against script to ensure 100% correct
* Package specimens for transport
* Stores specimen sample according to required temperature, places samples in appropriate collection container/ tube, accurately labels, follows different procedures as outlined by specific to protocol deemed necessary for transport to maintain integrity of the specimen
* Demonstrates proficiency of proper collection methods and proper processing of all specimens
* Understand and comply with OSHA and DEP regulations
* Attend annual department trainings
* Answer telephone calls, read laboratory results to satisfy inquiries
* Other duties as assigned

**EDUCATION:**

* High School Diploma or GED
* Valid Phlebotomy certification for the state where you will be employed as required (CA, LA, NV and WA requires certification)

**EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED SKILLS:**

* Minimum of 6 months' work experience performing venipunctures in a fast paced lab or hospital setting
* Reliable transportation with at least 4 years of licensed driving experience and possess a valid driver's license issued in the state of residence.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
* Must be willing to travel throughout assigned geography about 100% of the time
* **Provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination.**

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Excellent patient interaction skills both in person and by phone
* Strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS:**

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
\\* Ability to sit or stand for long periods of time  
\\* Ability to lift 20 pounds

BioReference Laboratories is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: On the road

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
**Marketing Specialist**

Chery Group

Garden City, New York, United States (On-site)

**Company Details:**

Chery Group is a US distributor of globally recognized heavy equipment and industrial product.

We are a growing and dynamic company with two distinct business divisions: Chery Equipment Group, specializing in the sales and rental of heavy equipment and tools, and Chery Industrial, offering a wide range of industrial products.

As we expand our operations and seek to enhance our online presence, we are actively seeking a talented and innovative Marketing Specialist to join our team. ***In this role you will be responsible for creating and executing marketing plans.*** Your primary focus will be on leveraging social media platforms and other digital channels to enhance our brand presence, engage potential customers, and drive sales growth.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Create well-defined marketing plans that align with the unique needs and goals of the company.
* Identify target audiences and tailor strategies to effectively reach and engage them.
* Oversee and manage our social media presence on platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube. Develop engaging and shareable content, run targeted ad campaigns, and build a strong social media community.
* Collaborate with our Content Designer to create compelling marketing content, including blogs, videos, infographics, and other visual assets to showcase our products, services, and industry expertise.
* Plan and execute email marketing campaigns to nurture leads, communicate promotions, and engage with existing customers.
* Conduct market research to stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences. Utilize insights to refine marketing strategies.
* Monitor and analyze the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, social media engagement, website traffic, and lead generation efforts. Utilize data-driven insights to continually improve marketing strategies.

**Qualifications:**

* **Bilingual in Mandarin and English**
* Minimum 1 year of successful experience in digital marketing, social media management, or related roles, preferably within the industrial or equipment industry.
* Strong understanding of various digital marketing tools, social media platforms, and email marketing software.
* Ability to think creatively and develop innovative marketing campaigns to reach new audiences and drive brand awareness.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey brand messaging and engage with audiences.
* Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.

**Pay:** $20-$22, nonexempt

Chery Group prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Chery Group conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.*

description:
**Join the GameChanger Fitness Revolution!**

At GameChanger Fitness, we're more than just a gym – we're a high-energy family of fitness fanatics committed to making fitness fun and personal! With ten bustling locations and more on the way, we are redefining Small Group Personal Training across the industry. Ready to bring your passion to the front line and help us turbocharge our community's health? We want you!

**We're searching for a spirited Head Coach for our brand-new facility!** 

As the Head Coach, you won’t just oversee our fitness programs; you’ll be the heart and soul of our new studio. Imagine leading a team of dedicated professionals, inspiring hundreds to reach their fitness peaks, and having a blast while doing it! If you thrive in lively environments and love making a real difference, you’re just who we need.

**What You’ll Do:**

* **Energize and Lead**: Command up to 30 exhilarating sessions per week.
* **Coach and Mentor**: Help guide and grow our team of spirited coaches.
* **Customize and Innovate**: Implement the unique GameChanger Training System for tailor-made member experiences.
* **Engage and Inspire**: Fire up our community with your passion and drive in every workout.
* **Drive Success**: Smash company goals through innovative local marketing and stellar service.

**Perks of Being a GameChanger:**

* **Career Growth**: Skyrocket your career with our expansion opportunities.
* **Professional Development**: Get access to top-notch certifications and fitness conferences.
* **Community and Culture**: Immerse yourself in a workplace buzzing with energy and enthusiasm.

**Are You Our Next GameChanger?**

* **Passionate about Fitness**: You eat, sleep, and breathe fitness and wellness.
* **A Natural Leader**: You’re driven to lead, coach, and inspire.
* **Experience**: You’ve got at least 3 years of fitness coaching under your belt.
* **Credentials**: CSCS, CFSC, NASM, ACSM, or ACE certs are a big plus.
* **Education**: A Bachelor’s Degree would be awesome but not a must.

Ready to make waves in the fitness world and help others reach their potential? Leap into action and apply today to become the driving force at our newest GameChanger Fitness location! Let’s change lives together and have a blast while we’re at it!

Check us out on Instagram: @gamechangergym

title: Phlebotomy Supervisor
description:
This is an exciting time to join our dynamic organization! BioReference, an OPKO Health company, is the largest full service specialty laboratory in the United States that gives healthcare providers and patients the power to make confident healthcare decisions. With a focus on oncology, urology and women’s health, BioReference offers comprehensive test solutions and unparalleled expertise based on a 40 year legacy of proven science and exceptional service. Join our team and become part of the journey in making our patients and customers the highest priority.

**Job Description**

We are looking for a Phlebotomy Supervisor (40 hours per week) in our Brooklyn locations.

**POSITION SUMMARY:**  
The Phlebotomy Supervisor will be responsible for a team of phlebotomist in a given geography. In this role the supervisor evaluates, trains and coordinates the day to day staffing of phlebotomist. Will need to communicate effectively to internal and external clients including patients, sales, client service, logistics, senior management, and others. The supervisor is responsible for the business at PSCs and IOPs. The supervisor must understand all fundamental phlebotomy and COVID 19 procedures and ensure that all phlebotomists are capable of following these procedures.

**PRINCIPAL JOB DUTIES:**  
Duties may include but are not necessarily limited to the following:

* Manage and schedule the day to day staffing and emergency coverage.
* Coordinate duties of phlebotomist. Assist with the interpretation of or clarification of miscellaneous test.
* Act as a main consultant when answering questions about unusual tests for customers
* Act as a liaison for troubleshooting problems.
* Conduct employees' orientation and training for phlebotomist.
* Ensures appropriate equipment and supply usage
* Assists in training of new employees
* Follow regulatory requirements, OSHA, and all departmental and company policies and procedures, including infection control and biohazard waste disposal.
* Follow all compliance procedures and policies.
* Contribute to the overall effectiveness of BioReference Laboratories, Inc. by performing nontechnical, educational and administrative duties.
* Perform all duties and responsibilities in a courteous and efficient manner, demonstrating positive customer service principles to clients at all times.
* Review applications for new hires and recommend termination.
* Inform manager of any issues.
* Review employees' performance 6 times per year.
* Complete timesheets and justify all overtime hours.
* Other duties as assigned

**EDUCATION:**

* High School Diploma or GED
* Bachelor's degree Preferred

**EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED SKILLS:**

* 5+ years supervisory experience-managing 20+ employees during different shifts
* Experience with all critical patients
* Proficient computer skills
* Phlebotomy Certified in states where required (WA, CA, NV and LA)
* Basic technical knowledge a plus
* Valid Driver's License required
* Must be willing to travel throughout assigned geography about 75% of the time

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS:**  
The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
\\* Ability to sit or stand for long periods of time  
\\* Ability to lift 20 pounds

**BioReference Laboratories is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

Pay: $60,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Safety Training and Development Coordinator
description:
**Title:** Safety Associate ‘A’ Grade 7 (OPEIU L153)

**Rate of Pay:** $63,738.83 (Weekly: $1,131.98 + $93.77 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Location:** Flushing Onsite – Monday thru Friday

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry is seeking an experienced candidate with strong technical background to work in our Safety/Learning Management Department. The ideal candidate will have a strong help desk background to provide analytical and technical support to our Learning Management System users and all related stakeholders. The candidate will possess analytical, technical, and high-level customer service skills within eLearning environment and Microsoft office.

The Safety Department is responsible for delivery of safety training to these members, and also works together with the Employment department to vet out members for the foreman’s list.

Our Learning Management System manages the administration, documentation, tracking, course management, reporting and delivery of all Industry related courses for approximately 15, 000 users.

Under close supervision, reporting to Director and Supervisors, the Safety/LMS Associate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

* Serve as the first point of contact for members and JIB employees seeking technical assistance, both on and off premises.
* Assist members in registering for online courses and setting up voice authentication for those courses. This may be done using facetime or Google Duo.
* Record events and problems and their resolution in logs.
* Direct unresolved issues to the next level of support personnel.
* Assist in testing and rollout of new versions of LMS and content.
* Work with other departments to train and assist with LMS tasks.
* Set up user accounts, permissions, and passwords.
* Take photos for New York City DOB ID SST cards.
* Provide support to members for the New York City SST program including but not limited to outside training verification.
* Assist in the processing and mailing of SST certification cards using inhouse programs as well as NYC DOB Training Connect.
* Serve as the first point of contact for members contacting the Safety Department with questions on training or safety issues for the Safety Director.
* Administering live lockout/tagout courses using the LMS.
* Setting up classroom for lock out class.
* Processing lockout tags and certificates.
* Administering weekly foreman’s tickets and reports for the Foreman’s committee.
* Work with Local Union # 3 processing new members.
* Work with the Apprentice Department processing new Apprentices.

**Work Environment**

This job operates in a professional office -- customer service environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as desktop computers, phone, scanner, printer, keyboard, photocopiers, shredder, and fax..

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday 8:30AM-4:30PM.

Flexibility: Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel** -- No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* Proficient in Microsoft Office.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills.
* Customer-oriented and cool-tempered with good interpersonal skills and a proven ability to interact easily and cooperatively with end-users and peers.
* Proficient in Google Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Internet Explorer.
* Proficient in Microsoft Windows servers and Apple based products.
* Familiar with Facetime and Google Duo.
* Experience working with a Learning Management System.

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**BENEFITS**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K (before FICA gross-up reimbursement) *without* mandatory matching, vested immediately before.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation.
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date: Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, NO employee premium. Coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, and DDS/Empire Dental. In addition, eligible employees may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability.
* NYS Paid Family Leave.
* Jury Duty and Death in family bereavement days off.
* 11 Paid Holidays
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Vacation
* Retirement plan – Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.
* Life Insurance.

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

title: Operations Aide- (CASAC-T)
description:
Under the supervision of the Operations Supervisor, the **Operations Aide (CASAC-T)** manages the day-to-day activities of operations of the program. He/she ensures the safety and security of residents at all times. He/she monitors the front desk, answers the phones, manages the daily client schedule and ensures that all client activities are completed. The Operations Aide is responsible for screening all clients and visitors entering the facility, providing crisis intervention, completing regular rounds and generating various reports to document events that occurred during the shift. He/she must be able to work all shifts (day, evening, overnight and weekends) since coverage must be provided around the clock.

**The salary for the Operation Aide (CASAC-T) is $22.00 - $24.00/per hour based on relevant experience.**

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Coordinate and ensure the overall functional operations of the front desk station.
* Maintains observation of safety issue and immediately reports any concerns to appropriate authority.
* Proficient in the use of computer, EHR, LabCorp and other electronic record systems.
* Checks patients in and out of the program daily and verify patient attendance.
* At check-in notifies patient when a service provider appointment is scheduled and/or lab testing are requested.
* Provides patient with specimen cup and printed label.
* Reports incidents, accidents and patients concerns or problems to appropriate clinical staff.
* Documents status of clinic in staff communication logbook.
* Monitor patient conduct and overall behavior during tour of duty.
* Provides general operator services, operates paging/telephone system as required.
* Attends and participates in in-service educational classes and on-the-job training program as directed.
* Assists with administrative duties as directed, assists other departments in administrative matter as directed.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**EDUCATION AND REQUIREMENTS:**

* **High School diploma or GED required**
* **Must be bilingual Spanish**
* **Must have CASAC-T certification**
* **Minimum of 1 year experience in Substance Abuse/Mental Health**
* **Supporting Recovery with Medications Addictions Treatment (MAT)**
* **Obtain within thirty days of hire: Screening, Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment, CASAC Canon of Ethics (6 hours), Confidentiality related to 42CFR (3 Hours), Mandated reporter (2 hours)**
* Excellent organizational, reporting, recordkeeping skills
* Ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing
* Ability to organize and maintain detailed records; complete necessary paperwork and meet deadlines
* Ability to make decisions based on education preparation and experience, which reflect consistency with Agency philosophy, policies and procedures, standards of care and review body requirements
* Bilingual – Spanish speaking a plus

**About Us:** Acacia Network, the leading Latino integration care nonprofit in the nation, offers the community, from children to seniors, a pathway to behavioral and primary healthcare, housing, and empowerment. We are visionary leaders transforming the triple aim of high quality, and great experience at a lower cost. Acacia champions a collaborative environment to deliver vital health, housing, and community-building services, work we have been doing since 1969. By hiring talented individuals like you, we've been able to expand quickly, with offices in Albany, Buffalo, Syracuse, Orlando, Tennessee, Maryland, and Puerto Rico.

**\\*Acacia Network is an equal opportunity employer\\***

title: Cashier
description:
**POSITION PURPOSE:**   
We are seeking a reliable and customer-focused individual to join our team as a Restaurant Cashier. The ideal candidate will handle transactions accurately and efficiently while providing excellent service to our guests. This role requires strong interpersonal skills, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES:** 

* Greet and welcome guests in a courteous and professional manner, ensuring a positive first impression of the company.
* Process customer orders accurately and efficiently using the POS (Point of Sale) system, including entering items, calculating totals, and accepting payment.
* Handle cash, credit/debit cards, and other forms of payment securely and in accordance with company policies and procedures.
* Ensure the accuracy of orders by confirming items and prices with service staff and guests, verifying any modifications or special requests.
* Maintain a clean and organized cashier station, including restocking supplies, cleaning surfaces, and arranging menus or promotional materials.
* Provide exceptional customer service by addressing guest concerns or complaints promptly and professionally.
* Balance cash drawers and reconcile transactions at the end of each shift, following proper accounting procedures.
* Follow all safety and sanitation guidelines to maintain a clean and hygienic work environment.

**KNOWLEDGE, EXPIERENCE AND SKILLS** 

* Previous experience as a cashier or in a customer service role, preferably in a restaurant or food service establishment.
* Experience handling cash transactions and operating POS systems with accuracy and efficiency.
* Exposure to fast-paced environments where multitasking and prioritization are essential.
* Guest-facing experience, demonstrating the ability to interact professionally and courteously with guests and coworkers.
* Experience handling cash transactions and operating POS systems with accuracy and efficiency.
* Customer-facing experience, demonstrating the ability to interact professionally and courteously with customers and coworkers.
* Experience handling cash transactions and operating POS systems with accuracy and efficiency.
* Customer-facing experience, demonstrating the ability to interact professionally and courteously with customers and coworkers.

**PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS OF THIS POSITION:** 

* Ability to sit and/or stand for extended periods.
* Advanced ability to operate office equipment such as POS systems, computers, telephones, and printers.
* Ability to lift and carry up to 40 pounds occasionally, such as when handling packages or office supplies.
* Mobility to move around the restaurant, including walking to greet visitors or deliver documents to different departments.
* Flexibility to reach, bend, and stoop when retrieving files or organizing paperwork.

**INTENT AND FUNCTION OF JOB DESCRIPTIONS** 

All descriptions have been reviewed to ensure that only essential functions and basic duties have been included. Peripheral tasks, only incidentally related to each position, have been excluded. Requirements, skills, and abilities included have been determined to be the minimal standards required to successfully perform the positions.  In no instance, however, should the duties, responsibilities, and requirements delineated be interpreted as all-inclusive. Additional functions and requirements may be assigned by supervisors as deemed appropriate. Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts.  The organization maintains its status as an at-will employer.

***Cipriani is an equal opportunity employer.***

title: Full Time - Head Cashier - Day
description:
**Essential Functions:**  

**NOTE:** Minors in this role may not be responsible for some of the activities listed below  

Assisted Self Check Out  

* Demonstrates ability to monitor and identify customers who need assistance at multiple self-checkout registers simultaneously
* Approaches and interacts with customers to proactively recommend products and services appropriately
* Proactively greets, assists, and engages with multiple customers on multiple registers at the same time
* Moves throughout the checkout area standing, walking, reaching, bending, lifting, and moving product to ensure accurate completion of transactions
* Thanks the customer for their business and invites them back to shop at Lowe’s

  

**Customer Service**  

* Provides SMART customer service at all times through the daily execution of Lowe's customer service policies, procedures and programs
* Seeks out customers to understand his/her needs and assists in locating, demonstrating, selecting, carrying, and/or loading merchandise
* Listens to and responds knowledgeably and promptly to customer and employee questions by taking them to areas of the store and walking them through projects when necessary
* Demonstrates sincere appreciation to customers
* Communicates information to customers regarding all stock, special order merchandise, feature benefits, application, and warranty information related to Lowe’s programs
* Coaches, develops, provides feedback, and trains associates in the various departmental duties or sales opportunities
* Uses a cash register to process sales transactions, returns, and refunds according to company guidelines
* Provides proper monetary change to CSA Front End associates for register activities
* Provides supervision, coaching, and support to CSA Front End Team (Front End/Loaders)
* Removes security tags, verifies product information, and bags merchandise for customers
* Answers incoming phone calls and directs calls or takes messages as needed
* Opens additional registers, when necessary, to ensure enough coverage always
* Assists in line vesting to help quicker turnaround time for checkout

  

**In-stock**  

* Prepares register area at the beginning and end of shift by confirming functionality of registers and scanners and stocking register supplies
* Inspects returned merchandise for damages
* Enters and submits customer orders, prints order tickets, verifies receipts, and signs off on loading tickets
* Reviews and places online orders and returned merchandise in the appropriate areas
* Looks up product information and competitor prices for products to verify price match
* Records all items that are used in the store on the store use lists

  

**Clean and Safe Stores**  

* Obtains safety bags from the cash office and monitors the amount of cash in the drawers to ensure it does not exceed requirements
* Monitors merchandise entering and leaving the store entrances and exits and assists customers or associates who trigger the alarm
* Detects common signs of shoplifting, theft, and other security risks, and promptly communicates them to management and/or Asset Protection
* Ensures compliance with housekeeping standards and programs (e.g., Zone Recovery) to maintain cleanliness and organization of store and working areas
* Maintains a safe and secure work environment, which may include conducting daily safety reviews, noting hazards, keeping aisles clear, and securing doors and gates
* Adheres to all safety requirements relevant to one’s regular job duties: top stock safety, reinstalling safety cables, use of aisle blockers, a tether line on power equipment, spotters, and safety devices
* Operates store equipment as needed depending on one specific role and department (e.g., Zebra phone, telephone, paging system, copiers, fax machines, computers, CCTV surveillance system, key cutter, panel saw, paint mixer, flooring cutters, compacter baler)

  

**General**  

* In addition to the above responsibilities, this individual is held accountable for other duties as assigned

  

**Minimum Requirements:**  

* Less than 1 year of experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information.
* Less than 1 year of experience using common retail technology, such as smart phones and tablets
* 1 to 2 years of retail experience as a cashier
* Must be able to lift items weighing up to 15 pounds with or without a reasonable accommodation

  

**Preferences**:  

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* 1 to 2 years of experience identifying and selling products based on customer needs, including credit cards, installations, add-on sales, protection plans, and explaining warranties, product features, and benefits
* 1 to 2 years of experience as a head cashier
* 1 to 2 years of experience working in any department at a Lowe's retail store
* 1 to 2 years of supervisory experience in any field, including directing, delegating, evaluating, training, and coaching employees
* Less than a year of retail experience detecting common signs of shoplifting (e.g., merchandise hidden inside of containers, merchandise under carts, price labels switched)

Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.

title: Full Time - Sales Specialist - Flooring - Day
description:
**What You Will Do**  

All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products our customers need. As a Sales Specialist Flooring, this means:  

* Being friendly and professional, eager to understand the customer’s specific needs in order to pair the best products and service offerings in support of their project.
* Ensuring displayed merchandise reflects our high standards of showroom readiness, operates as intended during demonstrations, and is up to date, accurately mirroring the manufacturers current product offering.
* Engaging in safe work practices including the proper operation of store equipment.


The Sales Specialist Flooring serves as an expert, explaining the specifications and features of a product or service to existing or potential customers, with the goal of closing a sale. This associate provides exceptional consultative services to customers and confirms their needs are met before leaving the store. The Sales Specialist Flooring is also responsible for executing orders and projects in their area of focus.  

*Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores.*  

  

**What We're Looking For**  

* Hourly Full Time: Generally scheduled 39 to 40 hours per week, respectively; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
* Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
* Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
* Minimally must be able to lift 25 pounds without assistance; may lift over 25 pounds with or without assistance.

  

**What You Need To Succeed**  

*Minimum Qualifications*  

* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* 1 year of external experience in customer facing sales OR 6 months Lowe's retail experience.

  

*Preferred Qualifications*  

* 1 year of experience entering and submitting customer sales orders, including Special Order Sales.
* 2 years of experience identifying and selling products based upon customer needs or plans.
* 2 years of experience in providing customer service including identifying and resolving customer complaints, greeting customers, answering phones, building relationships with customers, and thanking customers for their business.
* 2 years of experience following up on outstanding or incomplete customer orders, sales, or installs.
* 1 year of experience promoting product related services and plans such as installation, delivery, credit financing, or extended protection plans.
* 2 years of experience in a sales environment with required sales goals or metrics.
* 1 year of employment with Lowe's as a Sales Specialist.
* 2 years of experience in a trade directly related to flooring OR 2 years experience selling flooring.

If the state or local municipality requires a salesperson license for this position, you must either be licensed or pass the requisite licensing exam within sixty (60) days of starting employment in this position.

title: Marketing Associate
description:
**Kings Bay Y / JCC Brooklyn**  and

**Marketing Associate**

**The opportunity:**

Join Our Creative Team as a Marketing Associate!

Are you ready to be a part of a dynamic and inspiring community space? At Kings Bay Y / JCC Brooklyn, we're all about connections, uplifting, and inspiring. Our inclusive environment embraces individuals from diverse religious, racial, and ethnic backgrounds. We offer an extensive range of programs tailored for children, families, and seniors. Our offerings include early childhood programs, dynamic summer day camps, after-school programs, aquatics and fitness programs, multiple social adult day care groups, teen and children’s programs as well as teen and Israel programs at 5 physical locations in Brooklyn.

As our Marketing associate, you'll play a pivotal role in crafting our online presence across multiple platforms. You'll collaborate with our robust team to bring our mission to life through eye-catching content, strategic campaigns, and meaningful engagement.

**Qualifications:** 

* Preferred: 1 year of experience in a marketing-related field.
* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution preferred

**Skills:**

* A sense of humor, responsibility, and excellent communication skills.
* Proficiency in digital marketing tools (including but not limited to: Canva, Adobe, Microsoft Suite, CapCut) and social media platforms (i.e. Facebook/Meta, Instagram, YouTube).
* Excellent organizational skills.
* Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Eagerness to learn and grow.
* Familiarity with Jewish culture and traditions is preferred but not required.

**Marketing Associate Responsibilities:**

* Work closely with the Marketing Supervisor and other marketing staff to develop and implement comprehensive marketing plans for various programs focusing on children and youth.
* Assist in creating engaging content for various platforms, including social media, email newsletters, and the Kings Bay Y/JCC Brooklyn website.
* Assist with special events
* Collaborate with program managers at various locations
* Monitor and analyze the performance of marketing campaigns and adjust strategies as needed
* Maintain and update marketing materials, ensuring consistency with Kings Bay Y/JCC Brooklyn branding guidelines.
* Support the development of program brochures, flyers, and other promotional materials.
* Engage with current and prospective families through regular communication and follow-ups, including but not limited to Facebook/Meta Messenger, Instagram DMs, and emails.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices to ensure Kings Bay Y/JCC Brooklyn marketing remains innovative and effective.

**Job Benefits:**

* Health and vision coverage & dental coverage optional
* Pension Benefit plan, after one year, with agency contribution
* Life insurance, Optional 403/b plan & parental leave
* Generous Paid time off (PTO)
* Paid federal and additional holidays
* Employee program discounts

**Schedule/Location:** 

* Full-time position in person based in our Sheepshead Bay, Brooklyn office

**Salary:** 

* $50,000 to $60,000 commensurate with experience

**Mission Statement:**

Kings Bay YM-YWHA strives to build and strengthen communities, create meaningful relationships and lasting friendships, and foster deeper connections among individuals, families, and partner institutions in Brooklyn. From our flagship base in southern Brooklyn, where we operate a successful full-service community center, to our more recent inroads in Brownstone Brooklyn and North Brooklyn under the JCC Brooklyn umbrella, the Kings Bay Y has remained true to its 60-year-old mission.

To Apply : Send your resume to Tkzconsulting@kingsbayy.org

title: QA and Cutlery Care Associate
description:
**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a meticulous and dedicated QA and Cutlery Care Associate to join our Production team. This role is essential in ensuring that all knives meet company quality standards before delivery, maintaining cleanliness and safety in the Production and Kosher areas, and assisting in various quality assurance and care tasks.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Quality Assurance:**

· Assist the Production QA Specialist in checking the sharpness and cleanliness of all knives used in production, including Kosher Production.

· Conduct daily inspections of knives to ensure they meet company quality standards before delivery.

· Document and report any quality issues or discrepancies found during inspections.

· Provide backup support for the Production QA Specialist during absences or high-volume periods.

· Guarantee all quality control procedures and protocols are followed accurately and consistently.

· Participate in the implementation of quality improvement initiatives and projects.

**Cutlery Care:**

· Operate and manage the dishwasher to clean knives, ensuring all knives are thoroughly cleaned and dried before packaging.

· Inspect cleaned knives for any remaining debris or moisture, ensuring they meet cleanliness standards before delivery.

· Place cleaned and dried knives into designated boxes for delivery.

· Maintain a clean and organized workspace, including the dishwasher area and knife preparation stations.

· Adhere to all safety protocols and guidelines to promote a safe working environment.

· Make certain the Production and Kosher areas are cleaned regularly, adhering to the Production Floor Cleanliness and Safety Policy.

· Dispose of waste materials properly and ensure that cleaning supplies are stocked and used appropriately.

**Qualifications:**

· High school diploma or equivalent; additional technical or vocational training in quality control or a related field is a plus.

· Proven experience in a QA role within a production environment is preferred.

· Previous experience in a cleaning or maintenance role, preferably in a production environment.

· Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality and cleanliness.

· Excellent organizational and time management skills.

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

· Good communication skills, both written and verbal.

· Basic knowledge of knife sharpening and maintenance is preferred but not required.

· Ability to stand for extended periods and perform repetitive tasks.

**Physical Requirements:**

· Ability to lift and move up to 50 pounds.

· Ability to work in a production environment with varying temperatures and noise levels.

· Requires standing, walking, and inspecting products for extended periods.

**Benefits:**

· Health, dental, and vision insurance

· Paid time off and holidays

· Retirement plan options

· Ongoing training and professional development opportunities

**Disclaimer:**

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of personnel so classified. FPS retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position.

FPS is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, pregnancy, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, service in the uniformed services, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Adult Integrated Behavioral Health Clinician - Primary Care (PhD, PsyD, LCSW, LMHC)
description:
Summit Health is seeking an integrated Behavioral Health Clinician/Behavioral Health Consultant to provide assessments, interventions, and navigation to an adult primary care population in Westchester and Yonkers. The candidate will become part of a team consisting of physicians, nurses, behavioral health clinicians and psychiatrists focused on quickly providing help to patients and support to medical staff working to care for all aspects of their patients’ needs. We employ high level Cognitive Behavioral Therapy to treat a wide variety of patient conditions including depression, anxiety, panic, OCD, health anxiety and more. We offer intensive clinical supervision and education to help our clinicians become highly competent in CBT and certified, if desired.

**We offer:**

* High level CBT training
* Weekly supervision with a senior certified CBT therapist
* Weekly case conferences
* Collaborative working relationship with referring physicians and specialists
* Supportive working environment
* $1,500 annually for continuing education training
* Opportunities to engage in dept and companywide projects
* Year-end bonus potential

Candidates must have knowledge of evidence-based treatments for common mental disorders, familiarity with brief, structured intervention techniques (e.g. Motivational Interviewing, Behavioral Activation) and a desire to become skilled in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy. Experience working with patients who have co-occurring mental health and physical health problems preferred. Knowledge of community resources required.

**Education and Licensure:** 

* Master’s Degree required. Doctorate degree preferred.
* 3 years’ experience at the Master’s degree level, 5 years’ preferred; 1 year experience required at the Doctorate level, 3 years’ preferred.
* New York State Licensure in Social Work, Mental Health Counseling or Psychology required (PhD, PsyD, LCSW, LCSW-R, LMHC).
* 3+ years’ experience treating a primary care population.

***Pay Range $66,000.00 to $90,000.00.***

description:

The successful Sales Consultant will create opportunities within the territory by:

* Effectively routes territory, plans sales calls and follows through

title: On Call General Cleaner/Porter
description:
**Company Overview**

Safety Facility Services is an industry-leading provider of comprehensive facility maintenance services for commercial and residential properties of all sizes. We utilize customized technology and specialized systems to support our team of trained professionals, helping us deliver exceptional services to our customers. Founded in 1992 and currently servicing over 10mm SQF with over 500 employees, our company has evolved to include specialists in commercial cleaning, engineering and operations, architectural maintenance (metal, marble and wood), pest control, security, and lighting and energy solutions. And we’re about being sustainable, for your budget and the environment. It’s why we’re the fastest growing team in the eastern US.

**OUR VALUES**  
Our company is comprised of a of a set of operating principles called "core values". They are “Mary Minds, One Mission; Everything with Integrity; Be Accountable; and Adapt & Grow. These core values serve as the foundation for who we are as a company, how we conduct business, interact with our customers and, last but certainly not least, each other. We have a grand vision to be the best at what we do while also "Building a Great Place to work".

***(ON CALL) PORTERS / GENERAL MAINTENANCE***

Are you looking for supplemental income? Do you want to be called for shifts that fit your schedule? Do you find it interesting to work at various job locations and meet people from all types of backgrounds? If you are looking for a job that can offer flexibility, change of scenery, and allows you to thrive in a setting filled with new experiences, then we urge you to apply after reviewing the minimum job requirements.

We are seeking General Cleaners, Porters and other cleaning/maintenance industry personnel with related experience that have flexibility in their schedule, possess strong customer services skills, and have a strong sense of work ethic.  
We seek reliable and responsible workers who are always on time, follow the company's dress code and wear their assigned uniform & care about our customers. You are critical to the success of our organization because you represent the company at the customer’s site. This role is responsible for ensuring the customer’s site is clean and safe so that the residents have a pleasant experience. You will need to ensure all duties are completed with the high quality that Safety Facility Services and its customers have come to expect.

The ideal General Cleaner/Porter will be able to successfully perform the following responsibilities:

* Wipe down countertops, desks, and other surfaces
* Scrub kitchen and bathroom fixtures, including toilets and urinals
* Collect and dispose of office trash, recycling, and compost
* Hand wash dishes; load and unload dishwashers
* Spot clean cabinets, drawers, and glass surfaces
* Steel-shine appliances and fixtures
* Sweep, vacuum, and mop floors
* Communicate professionally with clients and Safety Supervisors
* Comply with safety policies and rocedures
* Maybe in charge of supply ordering
* Trash Removal and operate trash compactor
* Expectations of sorting and recycling garbage
* Maintenance and Grounds keeping related tasks
* Must have the flexibility to work a non-traditional schedule.
* MUST HAVE WEEKEND, HOLIDAY AND SOME EARLY MORNING/MIDDAY/LATE EVENING WEEKDAY AVAILABILITY
* Ability to speak and write English
* Reliable transportation to and from client accounts
* Ability to work in an isolated environment with minimal supervision

**1-3 years of experience in maintenance, housekeeping or custodial services**

**Physical Requirements:** walking and standing during the entire shift (often 4-8 hours), climbing stairs, kneeling to clean floors, pushing and pulling objects, lifting and moving objects (up to 50 lbs), repetitive bending and lifting, and repetitive arm movement.

**EEO Statement:** We are an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of the company to hire, train, promote and pay its associates without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, citizenship status, gender, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation or veteran status.

**Disclaimer**: The above statement is intendant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent (s) of the job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and activities required of the position. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

**Diversity Statement:**  
Safety Facility Services is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our human capital is the most valuable asset we have. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, inventiveness, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities and talent that our employees invest in their work represents a significant part of not only our culture, but our reputation and company’s achievement as well.

We embrace and encourage our employees’ differences in age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our employees unique.

title: Medical Assistant - Oncology
description:
About Our Company
We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.
Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.
When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.
Job Description
Position Summary:
The Medical Assistant (MA) is responsible for assisting physician, PA or NP with clerical duties, patient flow, patient care and procedures.
Essential Job Functions:* Prepares the examination room. Escorts patient into the room. Cleans examination room when exam is complete.
* Maintains efficient patient flow.
* Ensures proper preparation for patient visit. Prepares pertinent information needed for patient visit.
* Communicates & provides care consistent with age, cultural, spiritual and developmental needs of the patient.
* Answers the telephone in an appropriate manner. Directs calls and/or takes accurate messages.
* Schedules appointments accurately and appropriately according to departmental guidelines.
* Consistently and accurately stocks examination rooms with all necessary supplies.
* Assists in ordering and maintaining of all supplies as assigned.
* Reconciles encounters daily and accurately, according to policy guidelines.
* Effectively communicates problems, concerns or issues to the Supervisor and/or Manager appropriately and promptly.
* Understands and performs within scope of practice.
* Obtains vital signs: BP, temp, pulse, height & weight accurately and completely as required. Documents appropriately in EHR.
* Reviews and updates medication list and accurately documents known allergies in the Electronic Health Record (EHR). Demonstrates an understanding of prescription control and prescription refill procedures.
* Accurately documents allergies in EHR.
* Appropriately enters orders and schedules appointments in the Practice Management System (PMS) and EHR.
* Provides referrals and/or consult orders appropriately and in a timely manner in the PMS and EHR.
* Appropriately adheres to universal safety precautions when administering medications and disposal of medical waste.
* Maintains proficiency with department specific equipment, troubleshoots and reports malfunctions promptly
* Facilitates transition of care to UCC/Hospital
* Demonstrates flexibility with various work schedules.
* All other duties as assigned
* Recognizes and performs duties which need to be performed although not directly assigned.
* Provide scribing services.

Education, Certification, Computer & Training Requirements:* High School Graduate/GED / Equivalent Work or Vocational / Technical School / Diploma, required. Associate Degree’s preferred.
* Graduated from an accredited medical assistant or phlebotomy program
* 0-1 year related work experience, required. 2-4 years related work experience, preferred.
* Basic Life Support (BLS) or within 30 days of hire, required
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing, required
* Ability to organize and perform multiple tasks in a timely manner, required
* Basic proficiency in computer use, required

Travel:
Ability to commute to satellite offices as needed, required*Pay Range $19/hr to $25/hr**The provided compensation range is based on industry standards and salary determinations will be made based on numerous factors including but not limited to years of experience and location of position.*
About Our Commitment
Total Rewards at VillageMD
Our team members are essential to our mission to reshape healthcare through the power of connection. VillageMD highly values the critical role that health and wellness play in the lives of our team members and their families. Participation in VillageMD’s benefit platform includes Medical, Dental, Life, Disability, Vision, FSA coverages and a 401k savings plan.

Safety Disclaimer
Our Company cares about the safety of our employees and applicants. Our Company does not use chat rooms for job searches or communications. Our Company will never request personal information via informal chat platforms or unsecure email. Our Company will never ask for money or an exchange of money, banking or other personal information prior to the in-person interview. Be aware of potential scams while job seeking. title: Patient Representative
description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who see it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. Sun River Health is currently seeking a full-time Patient Representative/Front Desk Receptionist to join our team in our Amityville, NY.

**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\* $1500 Sign On Bonus- Terms and Conditions Apply\\*\\*\\*\\***

A Patient Representative/Front Desk Receptionist is responsible for providing patient centered care and facilitating patient access to services in a pleasant, knowledgeable efficient manner, communicating with a diverse population using well-developed interpersonal skills. This staff member will be responsible for all aspects of the registration and appointment process for patients. The staff member plays an integral role in the medical care team as the access point for patients to receive care. She/he will perform job duties in compliance with systems and job specific standards.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities for a Patient Representative/Front Desk Receptionist:

* Assist with daily reception activities and ensure that all processes needed for patient services are initiated.
* Communicates effectively with team members and patients all aspects of service.
* Responsible for telephone and mail contact with patients.
* Responsible for the scheduling of appointments, fee collection, explanation of services and charges for patient services.
* Distributes materials to patients, including the patient satisfaction cards, patient rights and other appropriate materials.
* Verifies all insurance and sets fees based on the sliding scale fee.

Minimum Education Requirement: High School diploma/GED

Minimum Work Related Experience: 2-4 years

Required Specialized Skills & Knowledge: Bilingual in both English and Spanish (orally and written)

Sun River Health is a network of over 40 Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) providing primary, dental, pediatric, OB-GYN, and behavioral health care to over 245,000 patients annually. With a dedicated staff of 2,000 doctors, nurses, and health care professionals, we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, affordable care to those who need it most. Sun River Health started in 1975 when four African American mothers spearheaded efforts to open our first health center in Peekskill, New York to deliver accessible, high-quality, affordable services to patients in need no matter their race, religion, income, or insurance status. Today, after 45 years of service, Sun River Health is still delivering on that promise to communities across the Hudson Valley, New York City, and Long Island.

title: Site Coordinator III
description:
**SALARY: $22.50 per hour**  

  

The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.  

  

To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.  

  

The Coney Island YMCA is seeking a Site Coordinator. Under the supervision of the Youth and Family Director, the Site Coordinator will play a critical role in providing academic enhancement and enrichment in the Y After School program, including Holiday Camps. The Site Coordinator will be responsible for providing a safe and positive environment for school age children, to provide opportunities for learning, interaction, and academic/ personal growth. Specifically, the Site Coordinator will ensure the health, safety and wellbeing of children in the program by providing close supervision of all activities and staff, manage the day-to-day operations of the Y Afterschool and Y Core programs, maintain accurate program documentation (incident reports, accident report, behavior report, attendance & sign-in / sign-out sheets, and licensing requirements).  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Ensure the health, safety and wellbeing of children in the program by providing close supervision of all activities.
* Manage the day-to-day operations of the Y Afterschool and Y Core programs.
* Maintain accurate program documentation (participant files, incident reports, accident report, behavior report, attendance & sign-in/sign-out sheets, and licensing requirements).
* Plan, create and ensure implementation of weekly lesson plans.  

Observe and assess the individual needs of children, handle student related issues.
* Support parents in finding referrals to proper agencies for evaluations and remediation of children with special needs.
* Monitor and update all required staff training attendance and certifications.
* Ensure that supplies and equipment are available and kept safe.
* Fiscal contract management.
* Actively participate in all training sessions and designated meetings.
* Promote an inclusive, welcoming, and respectful environment that embraces the diversity of all participants.
* Create and maintain a strength-based, youth-focused atmosphere that is consistent and sensitive to the needs of participants with learning, emotional, or behavioral differences.
* Maintain accurate program documentation (participant files, staff files, YS.net data entry, attendance, sign in/out forms, behavior reports, incident reports, and accident reports, as appropriate).
* Serve as a positive role model for participants.
* Understand and communicate the YMCA’s core values and the goals of the Y After School Program to participants and care givers.
* Develop and maintain positive relationships with parents and guardians through regular communication about their child’s strengths and areas of growth.
* Actively participate in training sessions, designated meetings, and special events.
* Adhere to all Department of Health, YMCA of Greater New York, and funder standards, expectations, and regulations.

 **Desired Skills & Experience:**

* College degree in related field required.
* Minimum of (2) years of experience working with youth.
* Current CPR/First Aid/RTE certification preferred.

 **Benefits:**


The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members, including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership, and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure, and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  

  

**How to Apply:**


If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.  

  

If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.

title: Associate I, Document Services (Work In Office)
description:
CardWorks Servicing ("CWS") is one of the largest privately-held provider of outsourcing services for bankcard-related products to banks and non-bank lenders in North America. CWS offers management expertise across the credit spectrum and supports both MasterCard and Visa accounts as well as a variety of private label debit, credit, stored value, and customer bankcards.

**Position Summary:**

This role is primarily responsible for the handling of incoming and outgoing mail, as well as preparation for our scanning operations by our vendor. Specifically, this role handles the distribution and collection of incoming mail, preparation, processing and forwarding of outgoing mail and determining, affixing, and recording postage on registered mail/packages, check handling for our Settlement Services department, and other mail room functions as required and the needs of the company evolve. As a Mail Room associate, this position also requires performing administrative and clerical duties inherent in the mail handling process and providing operational and cardholder support regarding these processes.

**Essential Functions**

* As assigned, tracks incoming mail, correspondence, checks, etc., and processes incoming/ outgoing overnight packages
* Plans, organizes and schedules assignment/projects assuring follow-through to completion
* Reviews, sorts and prepares incoming mail to be forwarded for imaging
* Assists other departments as needed
* Maintains knowledge or current policy and procedure changes and updates, and serves as a resource to clients, and external departments
* Processing of all security work received daily
* Handles the printing, folding, and stuffing for all outgoing correspondence to customers
* Processes ad-hoc scanning requests as received by other operational areas
* Performs delivery of mail to appropriate personnel and departments as needed
* Captures and destroys returned cards on a monthly basis
* Fulfills special mailing requests as needed from other departments
* Adheres to the regulatory timeframes and controls within the department and business unit
* Other functions and duties as required by management/evolving needs of the department

**Education and Experience:**

* High School Diploma or its equivalent education required
* One (1) year of related operations, support or mailroom experience required
* One (1) year of credit card industry experience is a plus
* Work-related inbound and/or outbound telephone experience highly desirable
* Experience working with computers is required
* Experience with First Data Resources (FDR), Evolve, or related platforms preferred

**Summary of Qualifications:**

* Must be able to work under pressure along with good time management and problem solving skills
* Keyboarding proficiency
* Familiarity with Windows based computer applications
* Ability to work under pressure; flexibility and willingness to work at a rapid pace
* Ability to understand and carry out oral and written instructions
* Ability to compose simple correspondence
* Ability to communicate with others and to assimilate and understand information, in a manner consistent with essential job functions
* Ability to multi-task is essential
* Must be able to complete work within required timeframes
* Must problem solve in an effective and efficient manner
* Must demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills

**Work Environment/Physical Demands:** 

* Work is in an office environment, sustained posture in a seated position for prolonged periods of time; works with computer equipment for prolonged periods of time.
* Some stress may occur
* Travel is generally not required
* This position reports to an assigned Team Leader and supervises no one

We offer a total rewards package comprised of a competitive base rate of pay, variable pay incentive programs based on the role, and a comprehensive benefit suite. Offered rates of pay are determined based on job-related knowledge, relevant experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location. Our benefits offerings include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) plan with company match, paid vacation time, sick time, as well as other benefits and programs to meet the needs of our employees. Further details will be shared during the interview or offer process, as appropriate and applicable.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We will conduct a thorough background check for all hires in compliance with applicable law which includes (but may not be limited to) a review of factors including the applicant’s personal credit history, drug testing, and employment/personal references.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.50 - $21.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Campaign Field Director
description:
**Join North Shore Strategies as a Field Director!**

North Shore Strategies is a New York-based political consulting firm with a national presence, offering comprehensive campaign strategies, digital media production, targeted canvassing, and direct mail campaigns. We collaborate with political campaigns, labor unions, and advocacy causes, supporting clients from local city council races to state legislative, Congressional, and large state-wide campaigns. Learn more at nsstrategy.com.

**Job Title:** Field Director

**Location:** Suffolk County, NY (Eastern Long Island)

**Start Date:** ASAP

**Compensation:** $5,000 - $6,000 a month

**Job Summary:** As a Field Director, you will oversee all aspects of the field operation for a political campaign, ensuring the successful execution of voter outreach strategies. This role involves managing field organizers, coordinating volunteer efforts, and ensuring that campaign goals are met. You will be a key player in developing and implementing strategic plans to maximize voter engagement and support for our clients' campaigns.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead and manage a team of field organizers, canvassers, and volunteers.
* Develop and implement comprehensive field plans and outreach strategies.
* Monitor and analyze voter outreach progress, making adjustments as necessary.
* Coordinate with campaign leadership to ensure field efforts align with overall campaign goals.
* Provide training and support to field staff to ensure effective canvassing.
* Manage field office operations, including logistics, supplies, and volunteer recruitment.
* Address and resolve issues that arise in the field.
* Maintain detailed records of voter interactions and outreach efforts.

**Requirements:**

* At least two cycles or years of experience in field operations for political campaigns or advocacy groups.
* A valid driver's license.
* Proficiency with Google Drive and/or Microsoft Office.
* Proficiency with VAN/Votebuilder preferred.
* Willingness to work nontraditional hours, including evenings and weekends.

**Essential Skills:**

* **Strategic Leadership:** Proven ability to develop and execute field strategies, with experience in managing complex operations and large teams.
* **Advanced Communication:** Exceptional skills in conveying campaign messages, training staff, and engaging with diverse stakeholders.
* **Relationship Building:** Strong interpersonal skills to cultivate and maintain relationships with volunteers, community leaders, and campaign staff.
* **Resilience and Adaptability:** Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment and adapt to changing circumstances.
* **Organizational Excellence:** Mastery in managing time, resources, and logistics to meet and exceed campaign goals.
* **Problem-Solving:** Proactive and efficient in identifying and resolving issues, ensuring the smooth operation of field activities.

**Why Join Us?**

* Play a critical role in shaping the outcome of key political campaigns.
* Work with dedicated professionals committed to supporting Democratic candidates.
* Enhance your career with senior-level experience in political campaigning and grassroots organizing.
* Be a part of a dynamic team where your contributions have a significant impact.
