title: Associate Director, Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Financial Reporting
description:
**Company Information**



Legend Biotech is a global biotechnology company dedicated to treating, and one day curing, life-threatening diseases. Headquartered in Somerset, New Jersey, we are developing advanced cell therapies across a diverse array of technology platforms, including autologous and allogenic chimeric antigen receptor T-cell and natural killer (NK) cell-based immunotherapy.



Legend Biotech entered into a global collaboration agreement with Janssen, one of the pharmaceutical companies of Johnson & Johnson, to jointly develop and commercialize ciltacabtagene autolecuel (cilta-cel) in 2017. Our strategic partnership is designed to combine the strengths and expertise of both companies to advance the promise of an immunotherapy in the treatment of multiple myeloma.



Legend Biotech is seeking **Associate Director, Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Financial Reporting** as part of the **Finance** team based in **Somerset, NJ.**


**Role Overview**



We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Associate Director ESG Financial Reporting to join our team. The AD, ESG Financial Reporting will be responsible for managing the company's Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) accounting, reporting, and compliance functions. This role will play a crucial part in advancing our commitment to sustainable business practices and maintaining transparency in our ESG initiatives.


**Key Responsibilities**


* Develop and implement ESG accounting policies and procedures in accordance with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices.
* Coordinate with internal stakeholders, including finance, HR, procurement, environmental safety & health, legal, and compliance teams, to ensure accurate and timely ESG data collection, analysis, and reporting.
* Oversee the preparation and dissemination of ESG reports, including annual sustainability reports, ESG disclosures, and other relevant documentation for internal and external stakeholders.
* Collaborate with external auditors and consultants to ensure the integrity and accuracy of ESG data and reporting processes.
* Stay informed about emerging ESG trends, regulations, and disclosure frameworks to continuously enhance the company's ESG program and reporting practices.
* Lead ESG training and awareness initiatives for employees to promote understanding and engagement with ESG principles and practices.
* Participate in industry forums, working groups, and collaborative initiatives related to ESG reporting and disclosure standards.
### **Requirements**


* Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, sustainability, or a related field; advanced degree or professional certification (e.g., CPA, CFA, GRI) preferred.
* 7+ years of experience in accounting, financial reporting, or ESG management, with a demonstrated track record of success in a similar role.
* Deep understanding of ESG frameworks, standards, and reporting guidelines (e.g., CSRD, GRI, SASB, TCFD, CDP, SEC).
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret complex data and communicate insights effectively.
* Excellent project management and organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple deadlines.
* Strong understanding of SOX 404, COSO Framework, and/or Internal Controls over Financial Reporting in a public company environment (biotech industry preferred)
* Commitment to environmental and social responsibility, with a passion for advancing sustainability goals within the organization and broader community.
* Ability to understand and navigate complexities of safeguarding internal, sensitive information with balancing external disclosures requirements including applying judgement to materiality assessments


#LI-Hybrid



#LI-LB1



Legend Biotech is a proud equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is Legend's policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.



Legend Biotech maintains a drug-free workplace.

title: Spa Manager, New York City
description:
**Company Description** **OUR STORY**


Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, **Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media** are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Our portfolio of brands is recognized globally with locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, and Vancouver.

**OUR CODE**


We are passionate about **high performance living** and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a **disruptive approach** to unleash it. We **dream big** and don’t settle for the status quo. We **sweat the details**. We never accept less than **110%** to **help each other** deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, **what’s next**. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture, and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value **humility** and a **team approach** at every level of the company.


If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others, then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.

 **Job Description**  

Equinox seeks a **Spa Manager** for its state-of-the-art locations in **New York City!**


The Spa Manager is a results oriented leader- energetic, creative, and enthusiastic. The Spa Manager makes a direct impact on a growing and dynamic organization.


The Spa Manager directs the staff at one of our Flagship locations to the highest level of customer service, total customer experience, and operational excellence.


Our philosophy embraces a well-rounded approach to results, where Spa constitutes an essential element of recovery. Our team is a collaboration of acclaimed holistic health professionals, influential specialists, and outstanding spa therapists that are selected from across the globe to create exclusive treatments to revive from the inside out. Our expert therapists provide signature massages to ensure members feel completely rejuvenated for future training. If it’s relaxation you’re after, our signature facials replenish the skin leaving a healthy glow.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Hiring & Training of Spa Desk Staff
* Scheduling Desk Staff
* Coaching of staff
* Service revenue goals
* Retail revenue goals
* Event planning
* Direct client outreach
* Direct client in-reach
* Product inventory

  

**Qualifications**  

* Customer Service experience
* Management experience and/or experience in Spa/Salon/Retail
* 1-2 years Spa Experience
* Massage Therapy and/or Esthetics licensure and/or experience is a bonus

**Pay Transparency: $58,500 - $70,000 and ability to earn bonus**

 **Additional Information** **AS A MEMBER OF THE EQUINOX TEAM YOU WILL RECEIVE:**

* We offer competitive salary, benefits, and industry leading commission opportunities for club employees
* Complimentary Club membership
* Perks and incentives with our products and services including Personal Training, Pilates, Spa and Shop


This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

**Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at** ***https://careers.equinox.com/***


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.

title: 24-25 NY College Counselor
description:
**School Year**: 2024-25


**The Role of a College Counselor at Achievement First:**



The College Counselor will ensure that 100% of seniors apply and are accepted to the best-fit four year college or university. The College Counselor will work with our scholars and their families beginning in the spring of their junior year, starting with the college list research process. The College Counselor supports seniors through every phase of the college application process including but not limited to college list creation, application essays (personal statements), supplemental essays, financial aid applications, interviews and advocacy work, and deciding which college to attend. The ideal candidate will possess an extensive knowledge of the college admissions and financial aid processes – including relevant state information - as well as the skills necessary to help students be successful in college. Chief among these are entrepreneurialism, systems-driven, organized, relentlessness, creative problem solving, and follow-through. The ideal candidate will also possess research, networking, and communication skills to connect students to unique programs on college campuses. In order to meet these ambitious goals, an ideal candidate must also plan carefully in order to ensure strategic use of time and resources. The College Counselor will report directly to the Dean of College.


**Responsibilities of Achievement First College Counselors include, but are not limited to:**


**College Counseling for a Caseload of Students**


* Support and guide all 12th grade students through each step of the college and financial aid application process
* Provide one-on-one college counseling to a caseload of 40-45 seniors through the admissions cycle including, but not limited to: creating a college list, writing and revising the personal statement, advising on financial aid, and making final matriculation decisions
* Work closely with parents and guardians of all students on caseload, including evening workshops and meetings for families
* Ensure students take advantage of special opportunities made available to low-income students in the college search and application process (i.e. fee waivers, fly-in visits, university partner programs and scholarships)
* Work closely with the AF College and Alumni Report Card to meet all deadlines and goals related to college partnerships


**Building Relationships with Students and Families**


* Plan and lead workshops for parents on key topics (financial aid planning, different types of institutions, scholarships, etc.) related to the college admissions process
* Ensure parents and students comprehend the different application requirements and deadlines, admissions policies and financial aid applications associated with different colleges
* Write and manage the collection of Letters of Recommendations for all seniors, including providing professional development and coaching for the Letter of Recommendation writing process for all teachers


**College/University Relationship Development**


* Contact and meet with campus admissions representatives to build positive relationships and market AF applicants
* Become familiar with the academic and social environments at the various colleges seniors are considering in an effort to recommend suitable matches
* Develop and maintain a robust network of college admission professionals through regular communication and high school visits from colleges and universities that best support first generation, low- income college students


**College Department Team Member**


* Assist with the administration of the SAT assessments (PSAT and SAT)
* Attend and give input on planning for overnight college trip for seniors
* Work with other members of the school-based college team to ensure alignment of summer opportunities and collect feedback from Alumni Counselor (when there are eventually alumni)
* Assist with specific projects and areas as determined by the Dean of College (based on expertise and knowledge base of college counselor).
* Additional duties as assigned


**Other School-Based Responsibilities:**


* Participate in school-wide professional development, grade-level teams, and school specific duties
* Support and participate in school-wide activities and programming
* Serve as an advisor for a group of 15-18 students


**Skills and Characteristics:**


* Ability to work urgently in a fast-paced and results-oriented environment
* Ability to juggle multiple tasks and initiatives at once
* Detail-oriented and self-directed, with relentless accountability to deadlines, internal and external
* Strong analytical and written communication skills
* Initiator, problem-solver, and creative thinker
* Ability to maintain emotional control under stress
* Proficiency with all MS Office programs including: Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
* An ability to work well with students, their families and the entire Achievement First Staff
* Belief in and commitment to the mission and core values of Achievement First Public Charter Schools
* Openness to giving and receiving frequent feedback
* Demonstrated ability to work on a team
* A dedication to learn, grow, and develop as a professional


**Educational Background and Work Experience:**


* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited four-year educational institution
* Previous experience in either high school counseling and/or college admissions field is required
* High School teaching or counseling strongly preferred


**Compensation & Benefits**


* Employees at Achievement First are provided with a competitive salary. Our salaries are set through a lens of equity, and based on an individual's skills, education, and years of experience relevant to the role. College Counselors' salaries range from $71,786-$77,308, based on experience.
* As a regular full time employee of Achievement First, you will be eligible for benefits that include medical, dental, vision, and life insurance as well as a 403(b) retirement benefit package with match and paid Family Leave.

title: Vice President of Accounting Policy
Logistics Support Manager
description:
**ABOUT SOTHEBY'S**



Established in 1744, Sotheby's is the world's premier destination for art and luxury. Sotheby's promotes access to and ownership of exceptional art and luxury objects through auctions and buy-now channels including private sales, e-commerce and retail. Our trusted global marketplace is supported by an industry-leading technology platform and a network of specialists spanning 40 countries and 70 categories which include Contemporary Art, Modern and Impressionist Art, Old Masters, Chinese Works of Art, Jewelry, Watches, Wine and Spirits, and Design, as well as collectible cars and real estate. Sotheby's believes in the transformative power of art and culture and is committed to making our industries more inclusive, sustainable and collaborative.

**THE ROLE**



The **Logistics Support Manager** supports the VP, Head of Logistics & Auction Operations by managing administrative tasks and leading special projects within the logistics department. The logistics department oversees the handling of artworks and objects from initial receipt, exhibition within the auction house and release to the buyer. This role is integral to maintaining efficient operations and ensuring adherence to budgetary guidelines. It offers an excellent opportunity for individuals interested in gaining valuable experience in the business aspects of the auction industry.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Coordinate and order supplies for the Logistics Team ensuring timely delivery and cost-effectiveness.
* Review and process invoices for goods and services related to logistics operations ensuring accuracy and timely processing to maintain positive vendor relationships.
* Assist the VP, Head of Logistics & Auction Operations, US in managing Logistics expenses and monthly budgets, collaborating closely with the Finance team.
* Monitor departmental expenses throughout the year and identify trends to assist in the forecast and budget planning process.
* Compile and analyze financial data to support decision-making processes.
* Support Logistics Manager, Warehouse Manager, and Gallery & Exhibitions Manager in scheduling Property Handler weekly overtime.
* Assist with Payroll Queries relating to Property Handler overtime collaborating with Payroll to ensure accuracy and resolve issue promptly.
* Update and Maintain Monthly and Weekly Key Performance Indicator (KPI) Logistics Reports, identifying trends and areas needing attention, for example, where Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are not met or there are abnormal workloads.
* Support special projects initiated by the VP, Head of Logistics & Auction Operations or executive management, for example, data gathering to support plans for upcoming move to the Met Breuer building.
* Act as project manager on tasks to be executed by Logistics Manager, Warehouse Manager and Gallery & Exhibitions Manager to ensure that projects are completed withing established timeline and budget.
* Perform general administrative tasks including correspondence, scheduling meetings, and managing departmental records.


**IDEAL EXPERIENCE & COMPETENCIES**


* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Logistics, Project Management or related field preferred.
* Proven work experience in office management, logistics coordination, or similar administrative roles.
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills with attention to detail.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Sheets and SAP.
* Display a positive attitude and adhere to Sotheby's Service Standards.
* This role operates in a professional office environment and may occasionally require presence in warehouse or gallery spaces.


The salary for this position is $65,000 to $70,000 per annum. Employees in this role may be expected to work overtime on evenings and weekends.In addition to base salary successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus, as well as a competitive benefits package. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered.

title: Dispensary Associate (Part-Time/Weekends)
description:
\\*\\*You MUST have availability Friday-Sunday to qualify for this position. More days during the week are likely to open up, but Friday-Sunday availability is REQUIRED.

(You will not work all 3 days unless that is your preference)

At **Unity Rd.**, we empower cannabis entrepreneurs by providing a roadmap to thrive compliantly and successfully in their local communities. **With 4 stores across Colorado, Oklahoma, and South Dakota, and over two dozen in development, we're expanding rapidly across 10+ states**. Recognized as one of the top cannabis retail leaders by MJBizDaily Magazine, we've also been named one of the “Best Cannabis Companies to Work For” in both dispensary and cultivation categories by Cannabis Business Times (2022 & 2020)

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a reliable and customer-focused Unity Rd. **Dispensary Associate** to handle guest transactions while providing exceptional customer service. In this role, you'll also share information on cannabis and cannabis-infused products, Unity Rd. services, and upcoming specials and events.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Ensure a comfortable and enjoyable shopping experience for all guests and patients
* Offer tours of our Unity Rd. shop to first-time visitors
* Assist customers in product selection, tailored to their preferences and needs
* Maintain a clean and inviting environment on the shop floor
* Process guest and patient transactions accurately and efficiently
* Calculate product costs and manage payments
* Address customer inquiries about products or services
* Identify upsell opportunities to enhance the customer experience
* Enroll guests in our loyalty rewards program
* Pursue ongoing cannabis education and product exploration
* Monitor product pricing, signage, and placement, ensuring accuracy and proper use of shelf tags
* Ensure compliance during transactions
* Keep front-of-house inventory stocked and organized
* Assist with periodic shop inventory audits

**Training & Growth Opportunities:**

At Unity Rd., we believe in nurturing our employees' potential and providing them with opportunities to grow within our organization. As a Dispensary Associate, you'll benefit from:

* *Comprehensive Training*: We offer an extensive onboarding and training program to ensure you have the knowledge and skills to excel in your role. Our training covers product knowledge, customer service, and compliance, as well as industry trends and insights.
* *Professional Development:* We encourage our team members to pursue continuing education in the cannabis industry, offering resources and support to help you stay up-to-date with the latest developments and advancements.

* *Collaborative Environment*: At Unity Rd., you'll be part of a supportive team that values collaboration, innovation, and open communication. We believe that by working together, we can drive positive change in the cannabis industry and foster a culture of success.

description:
*At Anchor Health Home Care, we deeply appreciate the privilege of being welcomed into the family circle to provide care for our neighbors' beloved family members.* Our dedicated corporate office team at Anchor Health Home Care serves as the central hub for communication among clinicians, patients, and families within our community. We firmly believe that in order to effectively address the evolving needs of our community, we must remain adaptable to ensure the delivery of exceptional care to both our pediatric and geriatric community members.

As a **Home Care Coordination Team Supervisor**, you play a pivotal role in guaranteeing that individuals in our community who require our team's services can access the appropriate caregivers promptly.

In this capacity, you oversee a team of 7-12 staffing coordinators responsible for maintaining efficiency and organization in staffing HHA/PCA cases. Additionally, you will conduct regular check-ins with both the coordination team and clients, all while giving priority to urgent client situations and caregiver cancellations.

**Home Care Coordination Team Supervisor Responsibilities:**

* Conduct regular check-ins with team of coordinators to ensure work quality meets expectations, identify areas of improvement of service delivery and gather feedback.
* Be able and willing to step in to provide support when challenges arise and effectively de-escalate urgent situations and last minute caregiver cancellations.

O&S Associates, Inc. is seeking Architectural Interns interested in historic restoration, building envelope design, adaptive reuse, and energy efficiency.

Candidates should possess a basic knowledge of AutoCAD, be good at collaborative work, have excellent written and verbal communication skills, and be able to organize themselves around tasks.

Our architectural services include assessment of existing conditions, restoration, and interior design. Our clients include healthcare, developers, multi-family residential, retail, transportation, and government agencies.

title: CASAC Counselor Transitional Housing (Brooklyn)
description:
**Job description**

**POSITION OVERVIEW:**

The Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC) provides alcoholism and substance abuse counseling services at designed shelter location(s). The CASAC utilizes holistic comprehensive assessment techniques to determine appropriate treatment needs and levels of care for clients. This includes performing diagnostic assessment, evaluation, intervention, referral, and alcoholism and/or substance abuse counseling in both individual and group settings when deemed appropriate. Participates as a member of the multidisciplinary team in the provision of client care. **Salary: $65,000.00 per year**

**KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Works within the shelter system to engage the client population in receiving substance abuse education, prevention, and treatment services.
* Educates clients on “stages of change” and meets clients where they are at in the process.
* Educates client on different levels of SUD treatment modalities including inpatient, outpatient, detox, rehab, short/long term care, prevention, and harm reduction care.
* Introduces clients to Medication Assisted Treatment (MAT).
* Completes comprehensive clinical assessments for all client encounters.
* Assist clients in the admission process that is deemed appropriate for their level of treatment services.
* Engages client in creating a Recovery Plan and/or Safety Plan to reduce high risk drug.
* Educates clients on client obligations, client rights and services.
* Documents all individual, groups, and/or crisis interventions counseling plus any other significant contact in the client’s clinical record.
* Documents techniques used during individual counseling sessions and group therapy to address behaviors, attitudes, and feelings.
* Provides ongoing direct services to clients, helping them with adjustments problems, referrals, substance abuse counseling, etc.
* Facilitate educational groups, workshops and events on SUD, MAT alternatives, Harm Reduction, and the use of Narcan.
* Participates as a member of the multidisciplinary team and maintains ongoing cooperative relationship with other disciplines to assure quality client services.
* Provides in-community services as specified by OASAS regulations.
* Maintain and updates referral service and resources that may be useful to this client population.
* Participates in clinical supervision as schedule.
* Completes daily progress notes and encounters.
* Monitors and tracks clients through identified database.
* Inputs client information in required database.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* High School Diploma required. Associate/Bachelor Degree preferred
* **NYS CASAC required. (No CASAC-T)**
* Must have specific training in chemical use, abuse, and dependence specific to the services provided.
* Obtain within thirty days of hire:
* Supporting Recovery with Medications Addictions Treatment (MAT)
* Screening, Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment
* CASAC Canon of Ethics (6 hours)
* Confidentiality related to 42CFR (3 Hours)
* Mandated reporter (2 hours)
* 3+ years’ experience in OASAS program.
* Strong leadership, excellent organizational and communication skills.
* Ability to work on a strong team of professionals in a culturally diverse environment.
* Ability to multitask and to work and function under pressure.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance

* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical specialties:

* Addiction Medicine

title: FT Hospice On Call RN
description:
Serenity Hospice provides caring and compassionate hospice care services to patients and families throughout New Jersey. Our mission is to alleviate pain and symptoms; foster a state of calmness and harmony; and encourage an appreciation of family, friends, and life experiences.

**Serenity Hospice** is looking to add a dedicated and compassionate **On-Call Registered Nurse** to delivering exceptional care, comfort and support to patients as needed. They will develop plans for individual needs, perform regular check-ups and communicate with family members as needed.

**Responsibilities:**

* Respond to manage distress calls as needed.
* Provide nursing care, emotional support and education to patients and families.
* Complete an initial assessment of patient and family to determine hospice care needs
* Regularly re-evaluates the patients nursing needs
* Use assessment data to determine care plan needs
* Collaborate with the entire healthcare team, patient and family, to help direct the work of the team to provide care that is continuous and well-coordinated
* RN counsels the patient and family in meeting end of life needs
* Registered Nurse initiates appropriate preventative nursing procedures
* Communicates with the physician regarding patient's needs and reports any changes in the patient's condition
* Supervises the Hospice Aides and LPN's

**Requirements:**

* **Candidate must be able to work nights including weekends.**
* **Candidate must be able to work on-call schedule (one week on, one week off)**
* Current NJ RN License in good standing
* Hospice Experience Preferred
* Willing to travel to the assigned areas
* Must have reliable transportation with liability insurance
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

We offer a competitive salary based on experience and a generous benefit package including Health, Dental, Matched 401(k) and PTO Days.

title: Tax Associate Attorney
description:
**Position Overview:**

We are looking for a proactive Tax Associate to manage sophisticated tax issues for a diverse clientele. The ideal candidate will work closely with partners and clients, providing strategic tax advice and helping to navigate complex tax challenges in a dynamic and supportive setting.

**About Us:**

Join a distinguished AM200 law firm that values excellence, innovation, and teamwork. We are dedicated to attracting and developing top legal talent, offering you an exceptional platform to advance your career while working on high-stakes cases for leading clients across various industries. Our firm provides a supportive environment that promotes professional growth and encourages a healthy work-life balance. This full-time position is available at our offices in Hackensack, NJ with a hybrid work arrangement of three days in the office and two days remote each week.

* **Full time position available at an office in Hackensack, NJ**
* **Hybrid work arrangement, allowing for three days in the office and two days remote each week.**
* **$200-315k/yr + benefits + incentives**
* **Relocation assistance available**
* **Partner track available**
* **AM200 Law Firm**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Perform in-depth research and analysis of federal, state, and international tax laws and regulations.
* Assist in designing and implementing tax-efficient strategies for corporations, partnerships, and individuals.
* Draft and review tax planning documents, including memoranda, opinions, and transaction-related documents.
* Advise clients on the tax implications of business transactions, mergers and acquisitions, reorganizations, and financing.
* Support tax controversy matters, including IRS audits, appeals, and litigation.
* Prepare and review tax returns and disclosures, ensuring compliance with relevant tax laws.
* Keep up to date with changes in tax legislation and regulations, and communicate these to clients and colleagues.
* Collaborate with other practice groups, such as corporate, finance, and estate planning, on tax-related legal matters.

**Qualifications:**

* Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law school.
* Bar admission in at least one state where the firm operates and the candidate intends to reside.
* Over 3 years of experience in tax law; an LL.M in Taxation or Estate Planning is preferred.
* Previous experience in an AM200 firm is required.
* Comprehensive understanding of federal, state, and international tax principles and regulations.
* Strong research, writing, and analytical skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Dedication to professionalism, ethics, and client service.
* Experience with tax controversy, mergers and acquisitions, and/or international taxation is an advantage.

**Compensation and Benefits:**

This position offers a competitive salary ranging from $200,000 to $315,000, along with a comprehensive benefits package designed to support your well-being and professional development. Compensation will be aligned with your experience and expertise.

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and empowered. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, including but not limited to race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, religion, and veteran status.

title: Manager, Logistics
description:
**Company Description** ***Fresh offers a hybrid working schedule with three fixed days in office, and two days remote. This role is based in our Jersey City Office.***

 **WHO WE ARE**


Fresh is a global company headquartered in New York offering skincare, lip care, bodycare, and fragrance in over 25 countries. With over 30 years of expertise, we are driven by our boundless curiosity and sky’s the limit approach. Whether developing a breakthrough formula, designing a marketing campaign, or welcoming guests in our shops, our teams are passionate about creating everyday indulgences that transform skin. As a lifestyle beauty brand within the LVMH group, we foster an inspiring, inclusive environment with world-class benefits that encourages everyone to dream big, because that’s how we got here.


Here at fresh, we intentionally foster a spirit of belonging. We celebrate our diversity and support every employee to feel welcomed, valued, respected, and heard. By embracing curiosity and collaboration, we recognize that our differences strengthen us.

 **Job Description**  

Come join a team that is responsible for shipping freight world-wide across multiple continents. While supporting both our HQ operations teams and local distribution teams, our logistics team is proactive, solutions oriented and always evolving. We are proud of our team and the impact we have across multiple internal and external functions across the world.

**Your Impact to the role:**

* Freight financials ownership to include freight billing, monthly reporting & analysis and implementing a strategic vision for how to reduce freight spend
* Emissions program ownership focused on forward thinking solutions to reduce our emissions and increase our cube
* Develop Logistics Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) focusing on internal *fresh* metrics and external warehouse metrics
* Partner with LVMH warehousing team to support new warehouse openings and best practice developments
* Partner with *fresh’s* freight forwarders and finance team to integrate all freight invoices into monthly reporting process
* Lead time ownership to provide direction to organization on trade lane updates needed
* Develop a Carrier Freight Rate Matrix to complete an RFQ (Request for Quote) for carrier operations
* Work collaboratively Logistics Analyst to offer daily support of role while continuing to build competencies and growth
* Offer daily support to internal *fresh* teams (planning, packaging, quality, etc.) to support excellent communications

**Your impact in your first year:**

* Develop KPI’s focusing on external warehouse metrics for *fresh’s* warehouses globally
* Complete successful warehouse transition in US in 2025
* Complete a market analysis that incorporates all freight impacts (to include transportation, inventory and planning function impacts)

 **Qualifications** **WHO YOU ARE**


You have:

* 5-7 Years of Experience Required in logistics or distribution
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills and attention to detail
* Excellent understanding of the worldwide supply chain and of flows (logistics, warehousing, IT)
* Ability to work in both an independent and team environment
* Knowledge of AX or other MRP software
* Manufacturing experience within beauty industry a plus


You possess:

* Proven Project Management Skills
* Strong Written and Verbal Communication Skills
* Proactively make recommendations on process improvement and new ways of working
* Ambition to learn more, with a curious mindset
* Strong passion for the beauty industry
* An out-of-the-box thinker with a Sky’s the Limit mentality

  

**Additional Information** **WHAT WE OFFER YOU**

**Training & Development and Culture**

* Fresh and LVMH Sponsored Trainings and Workshops for Personal and Professional Development
* Opportunities for networking and building relationships with LVMH Community and Network
* Opportunities to join internal communities: DEIB Council, Sustainability Champions, LVMH Employee Resource Groups

**Mental Health Support**

* Free professional consultation, referrals and counseling through the Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Free 24/7 confidential mental health support

**Paid Time Off and Flexibility**

* Comprehensive paid time off inclusive of Floating Holidays and Summer Fridays
* Two fully-remote weeks throughout the year to encourage flexibility; additional holiday weeks remote

**Fertility and Family Planning**

* Fertility Services, Maternity and Newborn Support, Adoption and Surrogacy Assistance, including cryopreservation when part of fertility treatment
* Paid Parental Leave (Inclusive of Maternity, Paternity, Adoption, Surrogacy) at eligibility
* Travel & lodging for those who can’t access care
* Back-up dependent Care and Tutoring

**Fresh and LVMH ‘Perks’ and Discounts**

* Fresh In-Store Discounts and Gratis
* LVMH Group Friends and Family Sales across all divisions within LVMH: Wines and Spirits, Watches and Jewelry, Perfumes and Cosmetics, Fashion and Leather Goods, etc.
* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits through Wage Works
* Additional Health Club Discounts, Sporting/Entertainment Ticket Discounts, Insurance Discounts (Pet, renters, home)

**Health Care**

* Medical, dental and vision

**Retirement and Additional Benefits**

* 401k with Company Match + Additional Employer Contribution at eligibility

*Fresh provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, gender (including gender identity and expression), pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital status, familial status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status under applicable federal, state or local laws. We are committed to fostering a professional work environment free from discrimination and harassment, including discrimination and harassment based on all protected categories.*

**The salary range for the role is $90,000 - $110,000 USD.**

**Based in Jersey City (Newport), NJ, with travel to New York City as needed**


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA)-Princeton
description:
Join Affirmed Home Care - New Jersey's Premier Concierge Home Care Agency!

Are you a compassionate and dedicated Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA) looking for an exciting opportunity? Look no further! Affirmed Home Care is seeking talented individuals like YOU to join our exceptional team.

*The holiday season is a great time to make a difference by providing companionship to our clients, while also gaining some additional income! We're offering expedited onboarding to get you started quickly!*

Why choose Affirmed Home Care?

· Competitive Compensation: We offer weekly pay, ensuring that your hard work is rewarded promptly.

· Referral Bonuses: We value your recommendations! Earn generous referral bonuses for every qualified candidate you refer to us.

· Driving Incentives: If you have a valid driver's license and reliable transportation, we provide driving incentives to make your commute easier.

· Rapid Onboarding: We understand your time is valuable. Our streamlined onboarding process ensures a quick and hassle-free transition into our team.

· Quick Placement on Cases: We prioritize matching you with clients who align with your skills and preferences, ensuring a fulfilling and rewarding experience.

· Overtime Rates: We understand how valuable your time is. Any hours worked after 40 hours in one payroll period entitle you to a rate at time and one half.

Requirements:

· Valid CHHA license in the state of New Jersey.

· Eligibility to work in the United States.

title: Accounts Payable Clerk
description:
**InfuCare Rx** is a leading home infusion provider accredited by URAC and ACHC offering a specialized approach to caring for patients in need of IV therapy and specialty pharmacy services in the homecare setting. We have created an ethical, team oriented, and quality work environment for our employees that cultivates achievement and success.

**Job Summary:**

The Accounts Payable Clerk will manage accounts payable, assist with performing monthly P&L and balance sheet generation, assist with processing monthly accruals, allocations, revenue reconciliations and perform other projects, as necessary. This individual should have a strong knowledge of the general ledger and its relationship with the various sub-ledgers, as well as a strong understanding of monthly accruals related to payroll and other expenses. This is a long-term position with potential for growth as the finance and accounting department grows along with this dynamic company.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Complete payments and control expenses by receiving, processing, verifying, and reconciling invoices.
* Charge expenses to accounts and cost centers by analyzing invoice/expense reports and recording entries.
* Flag and clarify any unusual or questionable invoice items or prices.
* Monitor accounts to ensure payments are up to date.
* Research and resolve invoice discrepancies and issues.
* Maintain vendor files.
* Provide supporting documentation for audits.
* Maintain accurate historical records and confidentiality of organizational information.
* Assist with processing of expense reports.
* Analyze chargeback items, including travel and other miscellaneous expenses, including reviewing and correcting variances.
* Review and check postings from various modules, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, fixed assets, and expense management to determine accuracy.
* Assist in 1099 Filings and any other A/P related filings.
* AP to Inventory Reconciliation.
* Assist with special projects and other duties, as assigned.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s Degree (CPA is a plus) in accounting, finance or related field of study and work experience in the accounting field.
* 2-4 years of relevant work experience in the health care industry.
* Accounting: 2-4 years of experience.
* Experience working with a multi-site and multi-state organization.
* Must be detail-oriented, able to prioritize and multi-task.
* Must be proficient in Excel, Microsoft Dynamics Business Central a plus.
* Ability to handle and maintain confidentiality of information.
* Demonstration of the ability to work in a team-oriented environment.
* Must be capable of functioning with flexibility in assignments.
* Must possess strong written and verbal communications.

Required to stand, walk, sit, talk and hear; required to use hands to operate vehicles and office equipment; must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs; specific vision requirements for this job include: close, distance and peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position without compromising patient care.

InfuCare Rx is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military status, marital status, citizenship/immigration status, sex (including pregnancy and relation conditions, sexual orientation, or gender identity), age (40 and older), disability, genetic information (including employer requests for, or purchase use, or disclosure of genetic tests, genetic services, or family medical history), retaliation for filing a charge, reasonably opposing discrimination, or participating in a discrimination lawsuit, investigation, or proceeding. Background checks and drug screens are part of our hiring process. Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

title: Quality Assurance Specialist
description:
Recovery Centers of America's South Amboy, New Jersey location is looking for a Full-Time QAPI Specialist to join the team.

**Schedule:** Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm

**Position Overview:** Under the supervision of the Chief Executive Officer, the QAPI Specialist will support company-wide initiatives to maintain the highest standards of quality care and ensure adherence to regulatory requirements specific to substance use disorder treatment and general healthcare practices.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Facility Departmental Senior leader that holds the responsibility to partner with all departments throughout the site to improve operational product, adhere to all regulatory and contractual requirements, and develop a culture focused on continuous performance improvement.
* Lead the consolidation and analysis of quality improvement data across the site .
* Co-Chair the following Committee Meetings with Site Leadership.
* QAPI, Medical Records, Safety, Infection Control, Pharmacy Therapeutics
* Responsible for patient safety, privacy, and ACTs investigations.
* Contribute to monthly reports for QAPI and Quality Governance Committees.
* Collaborate with teams to optimize quality processes and ensure compliance with industry standards.
* Lead in maintaining programs and strategies to ensure adherence to TJC/CARF, local, state, and federal regulations and payor requirements. Lead survey readiness / preparedness initiatives and committees.
* Support the data collection, processing, and preliminary analysis for various projects and reports.
* Aid in gathering and assessing feedback on the patient treatment experience.
* Assist in updating regulatory matrices and other compliance documentation.
* Work with teams to help identify areas for improvement and contribute to solution development.
* Participate in training programs on compliance and quality matters.
* Monitor potential risk areas and report findings to the manager, assist with development of strategies to mitigate risks, educate staff, and monitor implementation for sustainability.

**Knowledge & Skills:**

* Understanding of compliance and quality standards specific to substance use disorder treatment.
* Familiarity with local, state, and federal healthcare regulations.
* Basic proficiency with IT systems used in healthcare quality management.
* Ability to manage tasks effectively and meet deadlines.
* Good organizational and communication capabilities.
* Commitment to continuous learning within the healthcare compliance field.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and willingness to learn new software as needed.

**Personal Attributes:**

* Ethical judgment and integrity when dealing with sensitive patient data.
* Ability to uphold confidentiality in line with HIPAA and related regulations.
* Team player, eager to learn and contribute in a fast-paced environment.
* Cultural competence and sensitivity towards individuals from diverse backgrounds.

**Position Requirements:** **Education:**

* Minimum: Bachelor's Degree in a related field. Certification courses in healthcare compliance are a plus.

**Experience:**

* 1-3 years in a healthcare or substance use disorder treatment setting.
* Demonstrated understanding of compliance and quality standards in a healthcare setting is preferred.
* Previous involvement in data collection, reporting, or process improvement initiatives is beneficial.

A former patient may not be hired at the same location where they were treated until a minimum of one year has elapsed since the completion of their treatment at that location. Former patients may be considered for employment at locations within RCA other than where they were treated within a year after treatment.

**Performance Metrics:**

* Contributions to improved patient care quality, successful audit assistance, accurate data reporting, and collaboration with the wider quality and compliance team will gauge success in this role.

**Work Environment:** This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

**Physical Demands:** While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, sit, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work:** This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.

**Travel:** Travel is minimal and is primarily local during the business day.

title: Store Manager – new opening SOHO
description:
From Luxe Talent, an International Recruitment and Training Consultancy specialised in Fashion, Luxury, Retail, Food & Beverage, Hospitality and FMCG, we are currently looking for a **Store Manager** for one of our client, a jewelry brand that specializes in crafting fine silver jewelry.

In our recruitment agency we work with different firms in the Luxury, Premium and High Premium sectors around Europe, where we have offices in strategic locations such as Barcelona, Madrid, Paris, Milan, Amsterdam, Lisbon and Munich.

**Role Overview**:

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Store Manager to lead the new opening of a flagship store in SoHo, NYC.

The Store Manager will be responsible for all aspects of store operations, including sales performance, staff management, customer service, visual merchandising, and  
inventory control. The ideal candidate will have a passion for luxury retail, a keen eye for detail, and a deep understanding of the brand.

**Key Responsibilities:**

● Leadership & Team Management:  
○ Recruit, train, and manage a team of sales associates and support staff.  
○ Foster a positive and motivating work environment.  
○ Conduct regular performance reviews and provide ongoing coaching and  
feedback.

● Sales & Customer Service:  
○ Drive sales to meet and exceed store targets.  
○ Ensure exceptional customer service and satisfaction.  
○ Develop and maintain strong relationships with customers and local community.

● Store Operations:  
○ Oversee daily store operations, ensuring compliance with company policies and  
procedures.  
○ Manage store budget, including labor costs and expenses.  
○ Ensure the store is clean, well-organized, and visually appealing.

● Inventory Management:  
○ Monitor inventory levels and conduct regular stock checks.  
○ Manage product ordering and replenishment.  
○ Oversee inventory control processes to minimize loss.

● Visual Merchandising:  
○ Implement and maintain visual merchandising standards that reflect the Arvino  
brand.  
○ Plan and execute in-store events and promotions.  
○ Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure cohesive branding and  
messaging.

**Requirements of the Assistant Store Manager:**

● Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in retail management, preferably in luxury or  
high-end retail.  
● Strong leadership and team management skills.  
● Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
● Proven track record of achieving sales targets and driving business growth.  
● Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.  
● Passion for the brand and a keen interest in jewelry and fashion.  
● Proficiency in retail management software and Microsoft Office Suite.

**Benefits:**

● Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.  
● Employee discounts on company products.  
● Opportunities for professional development and career growth.

At Luxe Talent we want to help you achieve your goals, that's why we offer you the most interesting job opportunities in the Fashion, Retail, Luxury, Food & Beverage, Hospitality and FMCG market. Follow us on our social networks to keep up to date with all our news. Luxe Talent on LinkedIn or Instagram.

title: Game Night Crew
description:
BSE Global ("BSE") is a multifaceted sports and entertainment business that brings people together to experience music, sports, and culture through our teams and venue. Through these experiences and in our workplace, we strive to elevate our business, grow our fan base, and cultivate a community anchored in belonging and inclusion in every aspect, on and off the court.


**SUMMARY**



Under general direction and supervision of the Sr. Coordinator of Game Presentation. This position is responsible for handling, preparing, and executing all live elements at Brooklyn Nets home games for the 2024-2025 season. In addition, the selected candidate(s) will support leadership in proving a world-class game experience for fans in attendance. As part of the Game Night Crew, you will become an integral member of the team which supports the Game Presentation and Events department within the organization. This position is part-time position, but will require late nights and open availability for a majority (70%) of Brooklyn Nets home games as well as select special events at Barclays Center. The incumbent must be available 3.5 hours before each game starts in addition to one hour after the game concludes.


**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**


* Providing administrative support in coordinating all game contests, entertainment performances, and live camera hits. This can include selecting contestants, organizing prizes, prepping performers, going over details with in-arena hosts, etc.
* Assisting in the logistics, setup, service and daily operations of games and ensuring consistently smooth execution of each game
* Escorting and coordinating on-site experience for entertainment groups and talent that enter Barclays Center on a given date while also maintaining a high level of professionalism.
* Working closely with the Brooklyn Nets Entertainment Team Leads and Barclays Center arena staff in communicating necessary details on game days.
* Organizing Game Presentation storage closet and pulling the game specific items to facilitate future giveaways during a game.
* Supporting in-arena hosts at select games, reviewing details prior to contests, as well as camera blocking during live hits.
* Collaborating with in-house production crew at Barclays Center on specific needs during live elements (e.g. cameras, mics, lighting, etc.)
* Creating a high energy environment in the arena on any given night and playing a crucial role in hyping up our crowd regardless of the score.


**WHAT YOU WILL BRING:**


* No specific education or experience needed.
* Passion to work in live entertainment/sports is preferred.


**WHO YOU ARE:**


* Previous experience in Sports and Entertainment preferred.
* Currently attending a university or graduated and have interest in Game Presentation.
* Must be able to adapt to a fast-paced environment where attention to detail is critical for success;
* Must possess exceptional communication skills (both written and verbal);
* Must be able to multi-task, remain organized, and prioritize complex tasks;
* Maintain proper/professional decorum;
* Must remain open to feedback and professional development over the course of the season
* Must be personable and courteous at all times to arena, Nets, and production staff;
* Must have some knowledge in sports terminology and basketball operations;
* Must be punctual based on call times as well as have reliable transportation;
* Must exhibit sound judgment and discretion at all times with confidential information


**TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:**



This position may require travel up to 5%.


**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**



This position requires the ability to lift up to 10 pounds.


**ATTENDANCE:**



The incumbent is required to be available for at least 70% of all Brooklyn Nets home games.


**SALARY RANGE:**



$20 - $25 per hour


**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**



The incumbent may split time between Corporate Headquarters on occasion and the Barclays Center Arena. They will be expected to attend Brooklyn Nets games at the Barclays Center, as well as other events that may take place on weekends and/or holidays.


*We are an Equal Employment Opportunity ("EEO") Employer. It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of the Company not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, transgender status, pregnancy, marital status, partnership status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, age, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local laws.*

title: Level Up Squad
description:
BSE Global ("BSE") is a multifaceted sports and entertainment business that brings people together to experience music, sports, and culture through our teams and venue. Through these experiences and in our workplace, we strive to elevate our business, grow our fan base, and cultivate a community anchored in belonging and inclusion in every aspect, on and off the court.


**SUMMARY**



The purpose behind this role is to engage all Brooklyn Nets fans whether you are a lifelong fan or even if you have only attended one game. This interactive team will bring all the energy and passion in creating a home court advantage. You will see this group up in the 200s, on the concourse, as well as the 100s. Level Up Squad's presence will be all-encompassing with the goal of maximum engagement and ensuring that everyone feels a part of the gameday atmosphere. There will be an emphasis to elevate the experience in the upper-level sections through giveaways, intentional interactions, and Game Presentation contests/initiatives. Keeping the energy flowing up there throughout the duration of the game is very important. Additionally, this opportunity comes with learning back-of-house event production and game presentation experience on the NBA level.


* Pay is $18/hour for gamedays and $20/hour for outside events (i.e. Watch Parties, Community Events, Etc.)


**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**


* Being attentive and enthusiastic during all parts of the game.
* Leading t-shirt tosses and giveaways in the stands.
* Assisting with on-court contests and live shots. \\*At the discretion of their supervisor and captains.
* Constantly looking for sections that need extra attention and energy. Providing surprise and delight moments.
* Engaging fans through signs and hype prompter lines during different moments of a game.
* Being brand ambassadors to the organization and always maintaining a high level of professionalism.
* Must be available for at least 70% of Brooklyn Nets home games during the 2024 – 2025 season.


**WHAT YOU WILL BRING:**


* No specific education or experience needed.
* Passion to work in live entertainment/sports is preferred.


**WHO YOU ARE:**


* Maintaining consistent energy flow.
* Being friendly and willing to interact with fans of all backgrounds.
* Being open to constructive feedback.
* Must be able to be on your feet for extended periods of time.
* Knowledge of basketball rules is preferred but not required.


**TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:**



Traveling to Barclays Center for game day 2.5 hours before tip-off.

$18 - $20 per hour

Barclays Center

title: Entry Level Architect
description:
O&S Associates, Inc. is seeking a **Entry Level Architect** interested in building envelope design and restoration projects.

The ideal candidate is proficient in AutoCAD, enthusiastic, diligent in their work, well organized with good written and verbal communication skills.

O&S offers the opportunity to work with public and private owners on diverse building types from historic structures to modern high-rises. Our architectural services include assessment of existing conditions, restoration, and interior design. We have a thriving practice in the evaluation of buildings for water infiltration, waterproofing, and compliance with local laws, including the Façade and Safety Program (AKA LL/11) and Local Law 126.

O&S is a mulit-disciplinary firm that has grown steadily for two decades. Employees are encouraged to advance in their careers through internal mentoring and educational programs are in place to encourage professional growth.

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist Project Architect in conditions assessments and development of reports
* Assist Project Architect with construction documents including drawings, sketches, and specifications
* Assist with Construction Administration, including reviewing submittals and processing applications for payment
* Communicate via phone, email, to coordinate meetings, follow-up with contractors on open items
* Work on multiple projects simultaneously.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited University in Architecture
* Experience in architectural restoration and design projects preferred
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Familiarity with engineering, architectural, and construction principles
* Must be comfortable safely accessing roofs and rooftop structures via ladders
* Be able to take direction from team members.
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and AutoCAD
* Must be legal to work in the US

**Benefits:**

O&S Associates offers a highly competitive compensation package with generous healthcare benefits, and matching HSA and 401K. O&S encourages job related professional growth through funding Continuing Education and Training.

**About Us:**

O&S Associates is a multi-office, multi-discipline, full service Architectural and Engineering Design and Consulting firm, founded in 1996. For the last 25 years the firm has been designing new buildings and restoring existing ones. Our clients include healthcare, developers, multi-family residential, retail, transportation, and government agencies.

We are committed to giving our staff the tools and support they need to succeed in their professional roles, including a mentoring program for staff with less than 8 years of experience that benefits participants and the firm alike, monthly in-office learning programs, and funding for job-related continued education.

title: MQ Administrator
description:
**Job Title:** MQ Administrator  
**Location:** Jersey City, NJ  
**Duration:** Contract

**Job Description:**

* Responsible for enterprise-wide WebSphere MQ messaging infrastructure across distributed platforms including UNIX (AIX and Linux), Windows, WebSphere MQ Administration (V8.x &above) on distributed platforms (AIX, Linux, and Windows)
* Required to troubleshoot on AIX, Linux and Windows systems, build and run scripts.
* Required to administer MQ using MQE and command line using MQSC commands
* Responsible for the design and build of the Distributed Queue Management
* Responsible for the administration of Administer WebSphere Application Server (WAS) using ISC console
* Responsible for the administration and management of MQ Clusters
* Responsible for the administration and management of MQ Publish/Subscribe
* Setup security for WebSphere MQ queues& other objects for data access and for administration using role-based security
* Responsible for software installations and patches to WebSphere MQ servers
* Able to work with MQ monitoring tools like Tivoli Omegamon
* Required to work with application development teams providing support of middleware components.
* Define and maintain middleware standards and governance including MQ and API administration and utilization.
* Utilize industry standard technologies & methods to ensure the integrity & recoverability of MQ based applications incl. but not limited to: backup & recovery, clustering, security, patch management, enterprise monitoring & performance tuning.
* Perform strategic analysis and design of MQ infrastructure and makes recommendations on improvements and/or new systems required to meet business needs and future capacity.
* Serve as technical resource to business analysts, solutions development and other groups responsible for application development standards, system design and integration. Maintain professional knowledge of WebSphere MQ hosted on AIX, Linux, and Windows systems as required for the administration and support of a large-scale distributed environment
* Prepare and maintain professional documentation of server(s) / application(s) / network configuration(s) as they relate to middleware components and infrastructure.
* Ensure systems remain at operational excellence during infrastructure improvements (hardware/software upgrades, server migrations/consolidations, application deployment, etc.).
* Engineer solutions related to messaging that support and enhance business operations with guidance from Enterprise Architect Team and Technical Management.
* Provide 1st level technical support to IT Managers, DC Systems Managers, Information Security Team and Application Development Teams
* Participate in regular on call rotation, providing 24x7 support meeting business SLA’s.
* Provide technical leadership and mentor junior engineers supporting them to achieve excellence in their fields of interest and responsibility.
* B.S. degree in Computer Science or a related field and seven to ten years progressive IT experience including:
* 5+ years’ experience in WebSphere MQ administration on UNIX platforms
* 5+ years’ experience with MQ

title: Patient Outreach Specialist (Spanish, English)
company: Primary Home Care by Anchor Health
description:
*At Anchor Health Home Care, we deeply appreciate the privilege of being welcomed into the family circle to provide care for our neighbors' beloved family members.* Our dedicated corporate office team at Anchor Health Home Care serves as the central hub for communication among clinicians, patients, and families within our community. We firmly believe that in order to effectively address the evolving needs of our community, we must remain adaptable to ensure the delivery of exceptional care to both our pediatric and geriatric community members.

As a **Patient Outreach Specialist** you are the relationship bridge between our patient's families and our team, helping to ensure that the children and families have access to much needed support, resources, and homecare services, in a timely and effective manner.

**Patient Outreach Specialist Qualifications and Experience:**

* Fluency in Spanish and English
* Superior customer service and strong communication skills (written and verbal)
* Sales experience required
* Persuasive minded individual
* Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks

title: Legal Assistant
company: The Law Offices of Patrick Accisano, L.L.C.
description:
**Who We Are:**

The Law Offices of Patrick Accisano, L.L.C.

At The Law Offices of Patrick Accisano, LLC we offer decades of experience and superior legal counsel in estate and elder law. Our focus is to help people and their loved ones protect wealth, prepare for care in the future and navigate the difficult decisions that follow a loved one's passing. We pride ourselves on professionalism, ethical representation, thoroughness and enthusiasm.

We are a small firm with a team environment committed to making a difference for our clients and their families. It is a place where we help people who are uncertain or apprehensive about their future.

**Job Overview:**

We are seeking an enthusiastic, highly organized and detail-oriented Legal Assistant to join our team. As a Legal Assistant, you will provide administrative support to our lead attorney and paralegal and assist with various tasks related to the day-to-day operations of the office. This is an excellent opportunity for someone to gain valuable experience in an office setting and contribute to a dynamic law firm. This is a full-time, in-person position located at our office in Sea Girt, NJ.

*The Law Offices of Patrick Accisano, LLC is an equal opportunity employer.*

**Responsibilities:**

* Greet clients upon arrival at the office
* File and maintain legal documents in physical and electronic filing systems
* Schedule appointments, hearings, and meetings
* Manage attorney calendars and reminders
* Answer phone calls/emails and direct inquiries accordingly
* Manage accounts payable/receivable tasks such as sending bills and entering payments
* Maintain a clean, organized office space including supplies and monthly subscriptions
* Perform general clerical duties such as e-filing, photocopying and data entry
* Assist in legal support under the direction of lead attorney and paralegal

**The ideal candidate must possess the following skills:**

* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office & Google Suite (Word, Excel, Gmail, Google Calendar, Google Drive)
* Attention to detail and accuracy
* Familiarity of business letter formatting
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent organizational skills to manage multiple tasks and prioritize deadlines
* Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment
* Prioritize and maintain confidentiality among client information
* Have a positive, pleasant attitude and eagerness to learn (Must love dogs!)

* Google Suite: 1+ year (required)

title: Travel Baseball Coach
description:
**About us**

Rockland Peak Performance (“RPP” or “RPP Baseball”) is a high performance baseball training facility located in Paramus (Bergen county) in north New Jersey. We provide an unparalleled atmosphere that combines extensive strength training knowledge with a cutting-edge scientific approach to developing our pitchers and ball players.

After years of developing one of the country’s leading player development programs, RPP Baseball is bringing it all to our travel baseball program, RPP Revolution (13u – 17u).

Why?

We generally believe that travel baseball can do a much better job in developing young athletes. From training in the weight room to improving your skills on the field, from recruiting to nutrition, from speed training to throwing and hitting the ball hard, from mental performance to data analytics, we will bring the best of what we offer at RPP to Revolution.

We are looking to build a pre-eminent travel baseball program that can compete at the highest levels on a national basis.

**Overview**

* We are seeking experienced and passionate Travel Baseball Head and Assistant Coaches to join our travel baseball program. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in baseball (including at the collegiate level), the ability to teach and develop young players, and a commitment to creating a positive and supportive team environment.
* We offer a competitive compensation package and a great organization to learn and grow with as a coach for candidates that are passionate about the game.

**Responsibilities**

* Plan, organize, and lead / assist in baseball practices and games, ensuring that players are engaged and challenged throughout the season.
* Develop and implement game plans, strategies, and tactics that promote team success and player growth.
* Identify and address player strengths, weaknesses, and areas for improvement, making adjustments to practice and game plans as needed.
* Foster a positive and inclusive team culture that encourages player participation and respect for teammates and opponents.
* Work closely with other coache and RPP staff to develop and implement team goals, strategies, and policies.

**Skills**

* Experience as a baseball coach, preferably at the collegiate level.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with players, parents, and other coaches.
* Exposure to advanced baseball training either at the professional, collegiate, or elite high school level
* Passion, patience and excellent communication skills
* Must be a team player, honest, punctual, and responsible.
* Must have flexible schedule, which may include weekends and / or weekday availability for games and practices throughout the year.
* Open to learning!
* Must have access to a car!
* For consideration submit a resume detailing your Baseball background and experience.
